dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small and peaceful “jewel” of western Honshu... Jade-green hillocks terraced with rice paddies. Stands of ruby-red cherry blossom trees overlooking a sapphire slas river. And crowning it all stands the magnificent AKO CAS -- a six-tiered architectural poem written in wood and st  We can’t help but to sense the harmony of this place.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Ako Castle. Western Honshu, 1701 A.D. Suddenly a PRIMAL YELL shatters the scene.

dialogues.speaker: READY
dialogues.text: SFX: The DEADLY RASP of ONE HUNDRED SWORDS drawn in uniso

dialogues.speaker: KESA
dialogues.text: Instantly -- SCHUNK-SHUNKK-SCHUNKK! The sound of a hundre swords CUTTING through a hundred bodies. A great percussi of limbs thumping to the ground, which TAKES US TO:

dialogues.speaker: A FOREST OF EMERALD-GREEN BAMBOO TREES
dialogues.text: Each five inches thick and tough as iron. So many, we can see ten feet into the forest when --

dialogues.speaker: NORTH FRONT
dialogues.text: SFX: A company of men turning in unison.

dialogues.speaker: MISU-GAESHI
dialogues.text: On command, a hundred razor-sharp KATANAS flash diagonall through frame, SHEARING through the bamboo as easily as a knife slices tofu. But before the trees can fall, the swo slice back, lightning fast -- SHWOPP! -- cleaving them a second time horizontally! The pieces of bamboo tumble away...REVEALING an ARMY OF SAMURAI WARRIORS. Behind them, shouting the orders, is th commander, and chief samurai of the Asano Clan, OISHI KURANOSUKE. Oishi is in his mid-forties. A proud, stubborn throwback the great warriors of times past.

dialogues.speaker: EAST FRONT
dialogues.text: As the hundred warriors pivot with machine precision, PUL BACK TO REVEAL that we are not in a forest at all, but actually a CASTLE COURTYARD.  What we thought to be a bamboo jungle, our new angle now reveals are simply a multitude of TARGETS; Oishi is drill them at tameshigiri -- test-cutting with their swords. Oishi calls out another strike. Swords flash, bamboo fall And as the music RISES, we CUT TO: INT. AKO CASTLE - 6TH FLOOR - WOMEN’S APARTMENTS A beautiful young woman, MIKA (19), stands at the window watching the soldiers practice below, her gaze falling on in particular. Everything about MINORU (late-20's) is different. Of half European/half-Japanese descent, he is relegated to a lowe caste and practices away from the others. While the other wear samurai armor, Minoru practices in peasant pants and without a shirt, revealing a sheen of washboard muscle. A rather than a steel sword, he practices with a bokken -- wooden blade -- and thin air as his target. But despite his lower status -- perhaps even because of i Minoru has dedicated himself more seriously to the sword any around him. His moves have a fluidity and speed unequalled by anyone else we’ve seen. Suddenly, the ricepaper door behind Mika slides open and jumps with a start. The young daimyo of Ako castle, LORD ASANO (36), enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Mika-chan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Father.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I thought you would be practicing your dance.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: I was, I just got caught up in the... (awkward beat) ...the beauty of the day. Asano puts his hands on his daughter’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: This is important, Mika-chan. Of all the provinces we have been honored to host the Shogun and must make every effort -- (glances out the window at the warriors practicing) -- despite the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blushes ) Of course, father. He kisses her forehead and, as he moves off, is rewarded the first few footsteps and flutters of her FAN as she be to practice the dance of The Shrine Maiden's Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK with Asano as he descends through the castle. With visit from the Shogun imminent, the place is a beehive of activity: paper lanterns being hung, flowers being arrang in dramatic displays, children practicing the farmer’s fo song “Teru-Teru-Bozu"”. Asano offers a kind word or a gentle command to almost everyone he passes.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: (to a lantern hanger) Beautiful, Yasu. (to a child singing) Excellent. Very good. The child beams with pride. As Asano passes through the kitchen, we overhear the MASTER CHEF speaking to his APPRENTICE in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER CHEF
dialogues.text: ...finish cleaning the pheasants, then make sure that all the knives are locked away well before the Shogun arrives.

dialogues.speaker: APPRENTICE
dialogues.text: Of course, Master, but why..?

dialogues.speaker: MASTER CHEF
dialogues.text: Shogunate law. To draw an edged blade while the Shogun is in residence, even a chef’s knife, carries a mandatory sentence of death. The Apprentice blanches. Then turns and shouts at the kitchen staff.

dialogues.speaker: APPRENTICE
dialogues.text: All blades away now! NOW, I SAID!! Asano moves on, a smile wrinkling the corner of his mouth It’s clear that Ako castle is Camelot at its height -- th people of the province living happy, contented lives -- a Asano is its Arthur; noble, just and kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young lord enters the training grounds. Oishi and his samurai instantly sheathe their weapons and bow.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: My Lord. Asano calls out to Minoru.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Bring my horse. And another for the swordmaster. Minoru takes off for the stables like a shot. Asano then turns to the massed samurai.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Training is finished for the day. I need your captain. You men are dismissed. As the men move off to their posts, Minoru arrives with t horses. As the two men mount up, Minoru speaks to Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Do you need someone to accompany you? Oishi looks down at Minoru. It pains him to say this:

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You know it wouldn’t be appropriate. Minoru bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Of course not. Thank you for considering. Oishi wants to say more, perhaps a word of comfort, but L Asano turns his mount and begins to ride off.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Come, Oishi. And Oishi must follow his young master. The moment they’re gone, Minoru’s icy control melts. He grabs up a sword and, with a roar of rage, attacks the tameshigiri targets with a STUNNING MARTIAL DISPLAY. A blur of movement, he cuts a swath through the field of targets CHOPPING and SLICING, severing DOZENS of lengths bamboo -- then cutting them each into TWO, THREE, FOUR smaller pieces before they can hit the ground. It’s a lethal DANCE OF DEATH that grows FASTER AND FASTE until he wheels around to give the target behind him a FI

dialogues.speaker: DECAPITATING CHOP --
dialogues.text: -- and finds MIKA standing right there. Minoru’s blade whirls into his sheath faster she can blin Bows his head and AVERTS his eyes from the Lord’s daughte For an awkward moment, the two stand there, hidden from everyone else’s view in the heart of the bamboo field. Th Mika reaches out and gently lifts his chin with a finger, intentionally raising Minoru’s eyes to look into her own. The act is more intimate than a kiss. After a moment, Minoru remembers his place and pulls away

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: We cannot -——

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: What we “cannot” do is deny our feelings.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Mika... (serious) It can never be.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Silly, boy. Do you care for life so much to cease living it? (she caresses his face) Deny me if you can, my sweet Minoru, but I warn you, you'll find my love a stronger opponent than your doubt. She smiles and begins to kiss him. And before long, it is he who is kissing her. With all his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asano and Oishi ride along the road leading away from the castle.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to personally verify that the roads are presentable for the arrival of the Shogun. Oishi waits a beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: So where are we really going? Asano smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A land of mythic beauty... Asano hops about and shouts excitedly as he tries to land fish on the grassy banks of the Seto inland sea.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Come, my beauty! Don’t tease! And with a whoop he lands the fish -- a nice-looking RED BREAM. Its scales glimmer with ruby iridescence in the su

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Will you not look at this Goddess! Asano whispers a few words of praise to the wriggling fis then releases it back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Will you never keep one of those? You go to such effort to catch them.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I know I caught it. It knows I caught it. That’s enough for me.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Is this what happens when you get promoted from warrior to statesman? You become sentimental about the lives of fish?

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I prefer to think of it as enlightened.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: It is foolishness. Asano mock arches an eyebrow at the older swordsman. But Oishi is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it’s dangerous. (beat) Sentiment is a deception, Takumi. An imbalance in the Way of things. It’s choosing to look at life as how you’d wish it, rather than how it truly is.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: (smiles) And you get all this from releasing a fish?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (frustrated) All life is about balance. About order. I’m certain the fish would rather not be caught, but even it knows its duty is to give its life for its lord. (beat) In a fight, it is a matter of death to lose one’s balance. Political life is no different.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Fine. Next time I’1ll eat the fish.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: It’s not about the damned fish! The Shogun arrives in a matter of days and here we are, dipping our toes in the lake.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: The castle is prepared.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Yes, but are you? (beat) They call this visit a celebration, but it is an inspection, Takumi. Don’t delude yourself. I believe Lord Kira selected your province to try and convince the Shogun that your lands aren’t being used wisely. Do not underestimate him. He has the Shogun’s ear and an ambition not to be trifled with. The lands of the last two daimyo to have displeased the Shogun have gone to Lord Kira.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Lord Kira may have his ear, but like us, the Shogun is a samurai of the old ways. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up his fishing pole) Now, if you’ll excuse me... Oishi throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I give up. Talking to you is like talking to a geisha. A twinkle of mirth glitters in Asano’s eye. He rises.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Is that what you do with geisha? No wonder you’re so frustrated -- But as they turn, they are surprised to find a band of BRIGANDS atop the bank. A half-dozen murderous sellswords armed to the teeth: swords, yari spears, even a heavy wheellock arquebus.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGAND LEADER
dialogues.text: We’ll take the horses. It is impossible to tell when Oishi’s sword is drawn, it happens so fast. But Asano places a calming hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: No. Oishi looks the brigands over, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Ronin. He practically spits the word.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Come now. Just because they are masterless samurai, doesn’t mean they are honorless samurai. He turns back to the grim-faced thugs.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: BRIGAND LEADER
dialogues.text: Someone who’s going to see what his guts look like dancing on the ground if you don’t hand over the horses.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: You're very insulting.  10.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGAND LEADER
dialogues.text: And you're very stupid.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to me. (points to Oishi) You're insulting him. Talking so brashly and thinking only a half- dozen men is enough to protect you. (tsk, tsk) Very arrogant.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGAND LEADER
dialogues.text: Kill him. Asano shrugs and turns to Oishi as the thugs close in.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Diplomacy fails.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: In this instance, I can’t say I’m too sorry.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Leave one alive for questioning.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: If I must. And as the ronin close in, intent on killing the young lo Oishi takes a moment to look around. It seems as though h taking in his final seconds of life. But really he’s -- OISHI’S POV -- formulating a plan. He sees them coming and MENTALLY DISSECTS THE SCENE. From a WIDE ANGLE, we RACK IN on particular geographic features: the POSITION OF THE SUN, TANGLE OF ROOTS. Then on the WEAPONS EACH MAN CARRIES, noting each in VFX of its effective lethal range. And in the blink of an eye, Oishi’s got his plan.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATTLE
dialogues.text: Oishi wades in. In the BRIGANDS’ POV, it’s lightning fast In OISHI'S, it’s all in SLOW MOTION. As the first attacker (BRIGAND #1) charges in with a spea Oishi moves sideways, putting his back to the sun. POV SPEARMAN: With the sun shining in his eyes, Oishi appears in SILHOUETTE.  11. On reflex, the attacker uses Oishi’s shadow to BLOCK the bright sun -- which is exactly what Oishi counted on. Wit explosive speed, Oishi CRABS LEFT, momentarily BLINDING t spearman and STEPPING IN with a DIAGONAL UPWARD STRIKE. Like the tameshigiri targets he was training his men on, Brigand #1 is CUT COMPLETELY IN TWO on a diagonal bias. Without a pause, Oishi snatches the falling man’s spear a RAMS it into Brigand #2’s eye, killing him instantly. BRIGANDS 3, 4 and 5 charge into the gap, but in a surgica display of skill and ferocity, Oishi performs a happo gir ("the cut of eight directions”) CLEAVING them clean throu the torso, then further BISECTING their upper-half from s to waist. Like so much bamboo, the bodies FALL APART IN THREE PIECE It’s like nothing we've ever seen before. Now Oishi charges on the survivors. The tide of battle tu and the brigands quick-step back...right into the TANGLE ROOTS. They TRIP and go down hard. Brigand #6 raises his musket to get off a shot, but Oishi strikes. SEVERS the arquebus’ barrel -- but his sword SHATTERS to half its length in the process. No matter. Even with jagged stub of blade left, Oishi is deadliest thing out there. He JABS his ragged blade into musketeer’s throat, then WHEELS on a stunned axeman and performs “The Hourglass” -- a four-stroke zig-zagging cut that ends with the man’s body EXPLODING APART IN SIX PIEC Now only the Brigand Leader is left, laying on the ground screaming in panic. Oishi flicks blood off his shattered blade and approaches

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: They’ve forgotten how to make a decent blade.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGAND LEADER
dialogues.text: (hysterical) .-h..he said to keep one alive... But Oishi’s blade lashes out and CUTS OFF the Brigand Leader’s sword arm.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Unfortunate for you. Suddenly Asano CRIES OUT from behind. Oishi whips around in panic, gore-covered sword ready to strike --!!  12. Only to find Asano capering around at the water’s edge ag bamboo fishing rod bowed, another fish on the line.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Come now, my beauty! My little Empress of the Waves! Oishi shakes his head. And as he jams his broken katana i its sheath, we --

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAUTIFUL SEA BREAM
dialogues.text: On a cutting board. Then -- CHOP! As the fish’s head is slid aside and a knife begins delic work, WIDEN TO REVEAL we are: INT. OISHI’S HOME - KITCHEN - SUNSET A humble dwelling, as opposed to the majesty of Ako castl Clean. Simple. Comfortable. Oishi’s wife, HISAE (early 40's) stands at the board; a natural beauty with a smile that belies a deep inner- strength. The kind of woman every man wants to marry. Humming a folksong, her fingers nimbly turn the fish into sashimi while she stares out the window at her husband an their 16-year-old son, CHIKARA, sparring with wooden swor in the yard. She smiles contentedly. EXT. OISHI’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS The swords CLACK with the rhythm of war until Oishi sense opening and slaps Chikara on the leg with his bokken.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You switched to a left-handed stance. Try again. But time and again, Chikara falls back into defending wit his left and gets struck by his father’s sword. Hard. Blo meant to be remembered and learned from. Tears of frustration rise in the boy’s eyes. Oishi sees t and changes tacks. Removes his obi from his kimono.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Here. Let’s try this...  13. Oishi begins to tie his son’s left hand down to his side.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. Why all this?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Because every time you’re hit with strength, you switch to your left hand, and when you do that, you leave your flank exposed to right handed samurai -- Oishi cinches the knot down hard to emphasize the point.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: -- which is everyone. (ruffles his son’s hair) It’s for your own good. The two go back to practicing until Hisae comes outside.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: Enough practice, Oishi. You've been out here for hours. He’s a growing boy. He needs to eat as much as he needs to practice. Oishi relents with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: All right. Practice is over. He unties Chikara’s left hand.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (grins) .--but you will be eating with your right. As they move to walk inside, a RIDER comes galloping down footpath at full-speed. Stops only inches from Oishi. Oishi’s second-in-command -- and best friend -- HANJO (la 50's) dismounts the panting beast.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You're going to kill that horse, Hanjo.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: An envoy from the Shogun has arrived at the castle. Oishi stops dead.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: So early?  14.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: Lord Asano requests your presence to receive him. Like a flipped switch, Oishi goes into command mode.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Gather the men. Have them ready for presentation in an hour. Chikara looks up at his father, hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: No. You stay with your mother. It’s kindly said, and stings all the more for it. And with that, Oishi mounts up. As he rides off, Hisae tu to her despondent son.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: He’s hard on you because he loves you. But Chikara shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: He loves me...but I’1l never be good enough in his eyes. And Chikara walks off, leaving Hisae alone on the path, staring after the two men in her life departing in very separate directions...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. AKO CASTLE - DAIMYO’S SHOIN - 7TH FLOOR - MOMENTS LA The private room where the castle Lord receives audience. The paper walls and tatami mats are spotless. In fact, th only bits of color come from the black and gray kimonos o Lord Asano and Oishi, who kneel at the rear of the room. Just then, the shoji doors slide open and LORD KIRA enter an explosion of pomposity and sumptuous silk. Rather than the plain formal robes that Asano and Oishi wear, Lord Ki floats along in the most GAUDILY ORNATE ROBE we’ve ever s A dozen ATTENDANTS follow behind, wrangling Kira’s arm an leg sleeves that trail twenty feet behind. After countless precise steps, Lord Kira and his entourag stop and a COURTIER steps forward.  Asano and When Kira 15.

dialogues.speaker: COURTIER
dialogues.text: The exalted Shogunate’s Master of Protocol and most-honorable Lord of the Ryogoku domain, Lord Kira Kozukenosuke Yoshinaka. Oishi bow. speaks, we see his teeth are BLACKENED in the trendy, effeminate style of court aristocrats.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Daimyo Asano Takumi no kami Naganori... you may look upon me.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Fortune truly smiles upon us to receive so august a member of the Shogunate. Asano waits for a return compliment, as is the custom... after a moment, it’s clear none will be forthcoming.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: We were surprised at your early arrival -- Kira cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: You should be grateful for my early arrival. I went over the presentations you have planned for the Shogun. They were riddled with errors in court protocol. I have done my best to correct them, thereby saving you from myriad humiliations before the Shogun. Asano again bows his head to the floor. Oishi is clearly annoyed with Kira’s attitude.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lord Kira. In return, the people of Ako and I wish to offer you this token of appreciation. Asano claps two summoning sticks together and two retaine enter the room bearing a lacquered CHEST. Kira waves impatiently, and the chest is opened -- revealing a BOUNT GOLD COINS. But Kira stares at the glittering fortune, unimpressed.  16.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Token... (beat) A token gift indeed. Asano and Oishi are struck by the comment. Kira doesn’t care.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: A true gift is what has been bestowed upon you, Lord Asano. Wasted, in truth. Kira glances out the window at the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Only twenty percent of the land in the entire country is capable of producing crops. And yet here you sit with your cherry blossom trees and your grassy hills. (beat ) A man could raise an army to dwarf all others with fertile soil such as this. An ambitious man. Kira takes a handful of gold coins. Lets them slip disdainfully through his fingers, unwanted as pennies.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Pity. And in a flurry of silk and arrogance, Kira exits the roo When he’s gone, Oishi rises, knuckles white on his sword.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I'd like to strike that smug head from his shoulders. But the young lord puts a calming hand on Oishi’s shoulde

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: The world is changing, my friend. Courtiers like Kira are the new samurai. Guns are replacing swords. And the swords that remain are mostly ornamental. (indicates) Like yours. There was a time when it would've been unthinkable for your blade to shatter against the inferior ones of those ronin at the sea. But that was when the art of true swordmaking was still valued. Still cared for. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now the legendary koto blades are long since forgotten. Now outward expression takes precedence over inner core. Asano turns to the window and stares at the same countrys Kira did moments before.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: It is not Kira that is the problem in this age...but us. Then, almost to himself --

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Because we remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safely ensconced among barrels of sake and bolts of silk, Mika and Minoru hold each other in the moonlight. Gently, Mika traces his eyebrows with the tip of her fing

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: I like the shape of your eyes. But he lowers his face, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: They set me apart.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Yes, but in a good way. (beat) I look at your eyes and I see that your father loved your mother. Your face tells their story. Clearly, and to the world. Unashamed. (looks him in the eye) As someday I hope our children’s will tell ours. And as she smiles at him --

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Barely audible at first, but GROWING. Soon, loose grains rice on the ground begin to VIBRATE and DANCE. Minoru is the first to notice. Stops, listening.  18.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: What is it? Minoru doesn’t answer, but races to an arrowslit. POV MINORU: The darkened hillside. Then the low clouds begin to GLOW ORANGE from beneath as eight thousand torch

dialogues.speaker: CREST THE RISE
dialogues.text: The Shogun’'s ARMY has arrived. BACK TO SHOT: As Mika watches, Minoru races for the storehouse door -- then catches himself. Stops. Races bac Kisses her. And races out to find Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mist-shrouded castle looks like something out of myth a pagoda of the gods alight with the glow of ten thousand paper lanterns. Asano and his Honor Guard, headed by Oishi, stand within castle’s enormous main gate as the Shogun’s company arriv Bearing the HERALDIC CHARGE OF THE TOKUGAWA CLAN, the gre sea of warriors passes through the ancient gate. MYTHIC- LOOKING SAMURAI UNITS from the fifty provinces, each with own distinctive STANDARD or DEVICE: -- Kyoto’s CRIMSON DEVIL SQUAD in their lacquered, BLOOD- ARMOR... -- The IRON BOARS of Hizen, with two-foot-long sharpened TUSKS on their great helms... -- The Izumi TIGERS in their enameled TIGER-STRIPE PLATE ARMOR, bristling with STEEL CLAWS... And more. Edo’s PHOENIX REGIMENT. Shima’s SCORPIONS. Osaka’s WHITE CRANES. Five thousand mythic shapes filling the courtyard like warriors from some dark god’s fever dr Suddenly, all at once, they STOP. There’s a charged moment. Asano and Oishi exchange a glan Then, as if by telepathy, the armies SEPARATE, clearing a path for a SHADOWY FIGURE to walk forward. From a spiked chain wrapped about his fist, the Figure le four monstrous DOGS OF WAR. Snarling, snapping, they are each as large as a bullock; muscles rippling, ready to ki  19. But they’re nothing compared to the man on the other end the chain:

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN TOKUGAWA TSUNAYOSHI, (54)
dialogues.text: is easily the most intimidating figure we’ve ever seen. B in the Year of the Dog, his fearsome kabuto helm is rende in the shape of a great snarling DOG OF WAR. Six feet of heavy, scarred-covered muscle, the Shogun is survivor of a hundred grim battles and has been hard-temp into the very image of control. Of Law. As his dogs growl menacingly, the Shogun stalks up Asano stands there, weighing the young daimyo with his gaze. It’s an uncomfortable moment. But Asano bows regally.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi, the people of Ako bid you welcome. The fierce Shogun pins Asano with his gaze. Then nods.

dialogues.speaker: COURT ANNOUNCER, (VO)
dialogues.text: The rules of the melee are simple. If a warrior is struck, he is out.

dialogues.speaker: HARD CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. AKO’S OUTDOOR COMBAT ARENA -— DAY The stands are full of various LORDS AND RETAINERS from t Shogun’s entourage. In the crowd, FIND Lord Asano. Oishi and his daughter sit to either side of him.

dialogues.speaker: COURT ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The last warrior standing wins the exhibition in the name of their clan, and a boon from the Shogun. The Announcer nods to the Shogun who sits like a grim sta Suddenly, an oily voice speaks behind Asano.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (OS)
dialogues.text: I did not know your concubine was so lovely, Lord Asano. Asano turns to see the effete Kira staring at Mika.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: She is my daughter.  20.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: All the better. (bows before Mika) Your father forgets his manners. I am Kira Kozukenosuke.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Asano Mika. Kira’s eyes crawl over her bowed form.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: We will become better acquainted, you and I, Lady Asano. Kira maintains his gaze. It feels like hands roaming over her skin. Mika quickly becomes uncomfortable and just as Asano rises to intervene -- The Master of Protocol moves on to take his seat beside t Shogun. EXT. COMBAT ARENA —- READY AREA - CONTINUOUS Over fifty SAMURAI COMBATANTS are lined up to enter the r each wearing the DISTINCTIVE ARMOR and CRESTS of their cl One by one, they enter as the Announcer calls their provi TOWARD THE REAR OF THE LINE, Hanjo paces worriedly.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: Where in the Eighteen Hells is Taro? Minoru, check his house! Minoru sprints off to -- EXT. TARO’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Thatch roof and earthen walls. Minoru bursts --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: -- startling the COURTESAN who leaps up and tries to cove her nakedness. TARO keeps on sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: (shaking him awake) Taro, get up! The melee’s about to start! TARO!

dialogues.speaker: TARO
dialogues.text: (hungover ) What..? Huh? Oh yes, yes. Get my armor.  21. Minoru turns and grabs up the heavy cuirass bearing the C of House Asano -- two falcon feathers crossed over one another -- but when he turns back, Taro is passed out aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The combat floor has filled with the samurai combatants. Announcer calls the last warrior.

dialogues.speaker: COURT ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: And finally, fighting on behalf of our noble host. Clan Asano’s Torii Taro! But no one enters the arena. There’s a horribly awkward pause. Asano and Oishi share a look.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE READY AREA
dialogues.text: Hanjo is sweating it... until Taro races up in his armor.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: Oh thank the gods! Get in there! Get in there!! But as he runs past, we get a glimpse under his kabuto he and see that it’s not Taro at all, but --

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: He enters the arena and takes his place among the sea of samurai. So much MYTHOLOGICALLY-INSPIRED ARMOR, the battlefield looks like someone has sprung the gates of he Beneath his disguise, Minoru’s heart is racing, his breat coming too fast, skin sheened in sweat. And in that moment, he CLOSES HIS EYES and takes a breath Holds it until his mind is calmed...

dialogues.speaker: COURT ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Begin! And when his eyes FLASH OPEN, there’s steel in them, all evaporated. And the contest starts. The combat floor ERUPTS in a motion. Bokken flashing fast than the eye can follow. The SOUND of wood striking metal Leather. Flesh.  22. Minoru SWEEPS under the guard of a fighter with a MONSTRO LEVIATHAN FISH HELM, and STRIKES his abdomen. In an insta the man is out -- and so are half the other combatants. But there’s no time to rest as a Noto HARE springs forwar and attacks with the jackrabbit speed his clan is known f Minoru loses his footing and TRIPS, making an easy target the Hare. He’s a sitting duck -- But when he catches sight of Mika in the stands, he refus to go down like this. As the Hare leaps to deliver the eliminating blow, Minoru WHIRLS OUT OF THE WAY and RIPOST with a clean shot to the man’s legs. The Rabbit cries out he crumples to the ground. Other fighters close in -- But Minoru’s switch has been flipped. He picks up another sword off the ground and DUAL-WIELDS -- one in each hand. POV MINORU - as the field of battle swirls around him, impossibly slow. As an IRON BOAR charges, Minoru easily redirects with one sword and STRIKES the man’s helm with other, SNAPPING OFF AN IRON TUSK and sending him SPRAWLIN into the dirt. BACK TO SHOT — as Minoru wades through the fray like a killing machine, an ambidextrous engine of death, elimina fighter after fighter after fighter. IN THE STANDS - a corpulent daimyo turns to Asano.

dialogues.speaker: CORPULENT DAIMYO
dialogues.text: Your man is good. Asano nods, but beside him, Oishi is beginning to suspect

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Not that good. With Minoru coming on like a cyclone of swordwork, the surviving samurai start joining forces to take him out. It does no good. THE SHOGUN watches the display -- Minoru taking on two fighters simultaneously. Then three. The Shogun is impressed. Kira grimaces, wishing the fighter was anyone Asano's. OVERHEAD SHOT - the contest has separated into two distin maelstroms of battle across the arena from each other, swirling in opposite directions.  23. IN MINORU’S FRAY - Every remaining fighter joins forces against Minoru, six samurai against one. The rapid-fire CLACKING OF BLADES sounds like dominoes in a blender. And just when we think it can get no faster, Minoru takes up a level, INCREASING THE TEMPO and turning the attacker into defenders. Minoru establishes a RHYTHM to his double attacks, and on the defenders settle into it -- he BREAKS it, exploding i UNHOLY ONSLAUGHT that takes them all out. OVERHEAD SHOT - In the end, both battles resolve simultaneously, leaving only two fighters standing. Minor on one end of the arena...and a warrior from nightmare on other. Minoru’s opponent is a muscular giant, a foot taller than and clad in battle gear ripped from H.P. Lovecraft’s most horrific delirium. His armor is composed of lacquered bla SCALES; his helm wrought into the shape of a DEMON OCTOPU wrapped around his head, eight long STEEL TENTACLES dangl down his back.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: turns worriedly to Asano.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Father, who is that? But before Asano can answer, Kira leans in.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: The victor from last year, my dear. (smugly) My fighter... The audience is holding its breath. And at a nod from Kir his fighter marches on Minoru. Minoru waits for the sonofabitch to get in range, then BLAZES INTO A WHIRLWIND

dialogues.speaker: ATTACK WITH BOTH SWORDS
dialogues.text: But the Lovecraftian Samurai counters every single strike easily and continues marching on Minoru, relentless as a golem. Recovering, Minoru executes a tricky three-way cut, but t Knight WHIPS his head around and LASHES Minoru’s leg with steel tentacles, YANKING him from his feet. In a heartbeat, the knight rushes forward and unleashes a blow at full-strength at Minoru’s head. Minoru blocks wit both bokken -- And both of his swords explode into a thousand splinters!  24. The audience gasps. Only the handles of his obliterated swords remain in Minoru’s hands. Realizing his defeat, he rises and bows to the knight. But the Octopus turns to Kira, who nods -- And the bastard STRIKES MINORU IN THE FACE with all his might. WHAM! Minoru flies ten feet and crashes, sprawling into the ground. Again the audience GASPS and the entire world STOPS... But this time it’s because the helmet that has hidden Minoru’s identity...lays twenty feet away in the dirt. IN THE STANDS - Mika GASPS. Asano GAPES. Oishi lowers his head. LORD KIRA uses the thunder of the moment, pointing at Min

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: This is an outrage! (looks to Asano) Who is responsible for this?! Asano begins to rise -- but Minoru prostrates himself bef the great warlord.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: This was my vanity. Lord Asano knew nothing of this.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: How dare you wear the armor of a samurai! You’re a halfbreed!

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: I cannot deny it. (turns to the Shogun) But my father was an honored samurai. He fought alongside you at Sekigahara, Lord Shogun. I only wanted to display my skills before you to honor his memory. Mika’s heart skips a beat as Minoru stands at the center the ring. The Shogun’s stony eyes consider him. Then --

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: You have demonstrated great ability... Minoru’s eyes fill with pride.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: ...-but no matter what you accomplish, a halfbreed will never be worthy of being a samurai.  25. And the dream shatters.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: (to his men) Strip him of his armor and have it burned. It is tainted. Instantly, the Shogun’s elite guard come forward and star VIOLENTLY RIPPING the armor off his body. It’s brutal to watch, a public beating, and Minoru offers no resistance. The sheer intensity of the humiliation forces Mika to loo away. When they are done, Minoru, bloodied, bows low before the Shogun.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Forgive my arrogance.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: You are dismissed. And as Minoru makes the long walk of shame out of the are Asano turns to his daughter -- and is surprised to find h eyes filled with TEARS. Almost as if she was WEEPING. He watches her, genuinely confused by her emotion...until REALIZATION hits. Asano’s jaw drops as it all clicks together in his head. He looks again at Minoru; at his daughter... And realizes that they are lovers. As Asano sits back, stunned, mind reeling -- RACK FOCUS across the stands to Lord Kira, who has been watching the whole exchange. And he has realized it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shogun’s armies have bivouacked in the greensward aro the castle -- a city of tents billowing in the breeze, ea flying the PENNON and CREST of the unit housed within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A feast has died down and people are retiring for the nig The Shogun rises to leave, sending a courtier to Asano’s table.  26.

dialogues.speaker: COURTIER
dialogues.text: The Shogun will now retire for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Of course. Asano turns to the Shogun across the room and bows low. T Shogun’s face is an emotionless mask as he moves off. When the Shogun is gone, Asano’s calm veneer cracks and h eyes begin to search the room for something. Oishi clocks it.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You are troubled. I take full responsibility for Minoru’s actions today --

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: It’s not that.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: What then?

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I have to speak to my daughter. It’s urgent. TRACK WITH Asano as he moves off through the castle. As he nears the women’s chambers, Asano HEARS Mika’s voic WHISPERING around a corner. Small sounds of passion. Asano’'s face hardens and he rounds the corner to find Mi the embrace of:

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: But as the man turns, it’s not Minoru at all -- rather LO KIRA. And the sounds Mika was making were not passion, bu STRUGGLE. Seeing Asano, Mika’s eyes plead for help.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Father! Asano is there in a heartbeat, wrenching Kira away and HURLING him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: What is the meaning of this?! But Kira is a tower of fury.  27.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: (hysterical) Father, he was --

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Hold your tongue if you wish to keep it, girl!

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: That is enough! Kira’s hand moves to his sword.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: He was going to --

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: I said SHUT YOUR MOUTH! And in a blur of motion, Kira DRAWS HIS SWORD at Mika and Asano SLASHES OUT to parry the blow -- -- only to find that he’s been tricked. Kira does not have a sword in his hands...but one of Mika FANS severed in half by Asano’s gleaming blade. ECU as the slashed half of the fan falls to the floor. Though it’s light as a feather, the sound of it hitting t wooden floor is like the toll of Doom’s bell. BACK TO SHOT as Asano looks up...and sees Kira LEERING.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Drawing a weapon while the Shogun is in residence.. (ominous ) ..-is punished by death. And as the enormity of what Asano’s just done hits home, WIDEN TO REVEAL that several shocked onlookers stand in t hall -- castle retainers and a growing number of the Shog samurai -- staring at Asano’s UNSHEATHED BLADE in horror.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Guards! Take him!

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Mika... Mika-chan... Look at me. (when she does) It’s all right. Do you hear me? The Shogun’s samurai advance threateningly. Asano sets hi sword on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: There is no need for that. I will not resist.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: (as they seize him)

dialogues.speaker: NO, LET HIM GO --
dialogues.text: Asano sees Oishi appear at the edge of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Oishi, take her away from here.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: And as Asano is marched off, Oishi does as he was told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asano kneels in prayer at an altar of his ancestors. The robes he wears are pristine white.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let me see him, gods damn you, or there will be two more funerals this night. The doors are opened and Oishi enters the chamber. Oishi crosses the room to kneel beside Asano. Whispers.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I can get you out of here. I have several horses readied -- But Asano holds up a hand, stopping him mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Would you have me run from honor? Oishi searches for an answer that will stop this madness...but finds none. Asano meet Oishi’s eyes.  29.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: You know I cannot. You taught me too well, old friend. I broke the law and must pay the price.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You drew out of defense of your daughter! You were deliberately tricked --

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I knew the law. (beat) Over the generations, people may come to question the honor of Lord Kira, but never the integrity of the Asano name. The door opens and one of the Shogun’s COURTIERS enters.

dialogues.speaker: COURTIER
dialogues.text: The Shogun awaits. Asano nods and rises.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Oishi... I would be honored if you would act as my second.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Don’t ask me to do that. I cannot--

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I trust no one else. (then quietly, pleading) Don't make me do this alone, Oishi. I may appear calm, but fear threatens to unman me. Without you there, I don’t know if I can..if I will be able to-- As emotion begins to edge into his voice, Oishi calms him

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You will not be alone. Never alone. I will stand for you. Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And slowly, the fear melts away from Asano and a flinty resolve returns to his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: (taking Oishi’s hand) Thank you...old friend.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are lead toward where the Shogun waits. In his wh robes, Asano looks like a ghost floating through the hall

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: Father -!! Mika comes running and Asano embraces her. The guards clearly want to continue on, but Asano raises a hand.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: A moment... They grant it. Mika weeps into her father’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: This can’t be happening. This isn’t true.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: (gently) What is true...is that you have been, and ever will be, the joy of my life. As she begins to weep, he kisses her forehead. Then, out everyone in the crowded corridor, Asano locks eyes with Minoru.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Care for her.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: I wil-- But Asano grabs the hafu’s hand and repeats himself...thi time imparting a deeper meaning.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Care for her. Minoru is rocked by the revelation. He knows about us. Just then, a massive arm separates them, pushing Minoru a Mika back. It’s Kira’s best fighter -- the LOVECRAFTIAN SAMURAI that bested Minoru in the arena.

dialogues.speaker: LOVECRAFTIAN SAMURAI
dialogues.text: Move. His heavy hand grips Asano’s shoulder and forcefully lead him away. Into the chamber where the young lord will end own life. As he closes the door, Kira’s fighter looks back at Mika...and grins, enjoying the moment.  31. The doors close behind him with a crushing finality.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER -
dialogues.text: Mika races forward and yanks at the door, but it is barre

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: No! As she pounds at it, Minoru appears beside her.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Mika... He gently takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Mika-chan... And the endearment her father has used since the day of h birth reaches her. She stops struggling.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: I‘1l take you to him. And as grief overwhelms her...she allows herself to be le away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asano and Oishi enter. The Shogun sits at the far end of chamber with a grim-looking contingent of VERIFYING OFFICIALS, including Kira, who's clearly enjoying the mom A small table sits in the center of the room. On it is a RITUAL DAGGER. Asano crosses the room with a calmness that belies the ev about to take place here and kneels at the table.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: (bowing to the Shogun) I thank you for allowing me to end my life with honor, with my own hand, rather than the execution as a criminal as I deserve. The Shogun nods. Asano closes his eyes, contemplating for a moment... And then he takes up the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minoru leads Mika to a MOONLIT HILLTOP outside the castle gentle breeze stirs the branches of a lone CHERRY BLOSSOM TREE that grows there. Minoru sits Mika down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: But where is my father? Minoru moves to the tree...and plucks a sakura BLOSSOM. Presses the delicate flower into her hands.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Here. (beat) The sakura is the most beautiful of all flowers. It blooms for only three days, intensely beautiful, and falls at the height of its glory rather than withering away. (poignantly) It is the flower of the samurai. Mika stares at the tiny flower in her hand -- the poetic representation of the life of her father -- and allows herself to lose her grief in its beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asano sets the dagger down.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: Oishi. Oishi leans close, where only he can hear the trembling i Asano’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: I fear I will shame myself. If I should cry out --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You will not. (then) You will not. The strength and assuredness in Oishi’s voice flows into Asano. With resolve, he again picks up the dagger. MUSIC RISES and we INTERCUT with MIKA staring at the cher blossom in her hand. With ASANO opening his robes to expo his abdomen.  33. With OISHI drawing his sword to stand behind his lord, preparing cut off the head of his student -- his friend - should the pain become too great. And as the music reaches CRESCENDO, Asano PLUNGES the dag into his belly, CUTTING SIDEWAYS then UP, disemboweling himself before the Shogun. The seconds stretch out. OISHI is in turmoil as Asano remains utterly stoic. Glances up see KIRA with a slight smile curving his lips -- a memory that burns itself in his brain forever. ASANO holds on as long as he can, but as the suffering overwhelms him and he begins to CRY OUT -- SCHWOP! OISHI is there to strike down and preserve his dignity. ASANO'S BODY topples forward, a pool of red blood spreadi across the white floor...

dialogues.speaker: AND AT THAT EXACT MOMENT ON THE HILLTOP,
dialogues.text: A breeze stirs the sakura tree and a thousand cherry blos float down through the moonglow to embrace Mika in a rain otherworldly beauty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Asano’s entire army of three-hundred-and-fifty samur has amassed in the heart of the castle. An argument is go on. Some are shouting for calm, most are GIRDING THEMSELV FOR WAR.

dialogues.speaker: AGING SAMURAI
dialogues.text: This is madness! The Shogun issued a direct mandate: there are to be no reprisals against Lord Kira! A hot-tempered samurai, ISOGAI, straps on his sword.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: The Shogun be damned! Bushido says we avenge our master at all costs! On the far side of the room, OISHI stands, peering throug SHOOTING HOLE, lost in thought. Outside, the Shogunate’s samurai are massing before the armory, Lord Kira’s men in the vanguard. Oishi’s forces a desperately outnumbered. It will be a slaughter. Reverently, Minoru steps up beside Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: What say you, Blademaster?  34. The question wakes Oishi from his thoughts. He turns from the window. Then, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: We fight. A great cheer goes up from the men. Minoru moves to a sta holding many swords.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Which weapon shall you choose, my Lord? Oishi takes one last look out the window. Sees Kira grinn like a demon.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Patience.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: (confused) What..? And Oishi issues the last order they would ever expect.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: There will be no more bloodshed today. Set down your weapons. As one, the samurai are staggered with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER SAMURAI SAMURAI
dialogues.text: You mistake us for cowards! We must avenge the death of We are not afraid to die! our Lord!

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Look outside. You will not succeed.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Success or failure does not matter! The only thing that is important is that we uphold Honor by trying!

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: You craven dog --! With a shocking display of speed, Oishi reaches out and H the haughty young samurai to the floor. Oishi has his sho sword out and at the gasping man’s throat in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It matters...because if we fail, Kira lives and our Lord’s murder will go unavenged. Put your honor aside. I have a duty. (pointedly) As do you all. 35. Now Oishi pulls from his robes the dagger with which Asan took his own life.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Because of Kira, our master took his own life with this blade. (beat) I will not rest until Kira does the same. As his words sink in, Oishi removes his blade from Isogai throat and stands. Hanjo, Oishi’s right-hand man, steps up.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: So what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: A great warrior once told me, “If the enemy thinks of the mountains, attack like the sea; and if he thinks of the sea, attack like the mountains.” (beat) We wait. Oishi scans the room, meeting each man’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: We wait until this day is but a memory to them, until they believe our spirit is broken and the danger has passed... And when all their suspicions have been quenched and their guard has finally dropped, we will gather as one -- In a blink, Oishi turns and buries the sword in a thick wooden beam -- THUNKK!

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: And then we will strike. Oishi takes the dagger and draws the blade across his pal making a thin slice across his sword hand. blade out to the others. One by one, they all do the same. Then holds the  36. The blood pact is complete. SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a lockbar sliding... Then the great doors swing w to reveal OISHI, weaponless. He and his men exit and are marshalled by a thousand Shogunate soldiers to be stood before:

dialogues.speaker: THE SHOGUN AND LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Forced to stand beside him, Mika watches with a soulless stoicism as Lord Kira addresses the surrendered samurai.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons, all of you. The sound of over three hundred swords striking the groun the sound of the death of an entire clan.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now remove your crest. Oishi’s men look to one another in shock, reluctant to do

dialogues.speaker: REMOVE THEM
dialogues.text: As one, they turn to Oishi...but he does not meet their e Merely nods. Across the gulf of soldiers, Mika meets Minoru’s eyes...a cannot endure the shame she sees there. Tries to turn awa but Kira reaches out and GRASPS her wrist, wrenching her around so she must watch. Minoru sees it and instantly reaches for his sword -- but Oishi restrains him with a firm hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Patience. And slowly, Minoru’s muscles unbunch...and he relents. In utter shame, Oishi’s men drop their formal kimonos bea the crossed-feather crest of House Asano into the mud.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Your master is dead. House Asano is no more. You have failed them both. (beat) You are no longer worthy of the title “samurai”. From this moment forward, you are ronin.  37. The word strikes Asano’s men like a slap to the face.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honorless. Reviled. Cowards. (venomous ) You are banished from these lands. Those of you still here by the ring of the third bell will be hunted down and executed. With a nod from their Lord, Kira’s warriors SURGE IN and begin driving Asano’s disgraced men from the castle groun

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Except you. (indicates Oishi) Arrest him. Kira returns to his place beside the Shogun as a dozen me knock Oishi brutally to the ground. Oishi offers no resistance as they roughly begin binding his wrists. The Shogun turns to leave, but stops before Kira.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: (re: Oishi) He is not to be killed. He was a hero at Nagoya. Kira bows his assent as the Shogun strides away. When he’ gone, he turns to the soldiers holding Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: He is not to be executed. (beat) Break him instead. The soldiers nod, and as Oishi is dragged away in chains

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mika is brought before the Shogun and Lord Kira by soldie The Shogun speaks in an imperial tone that brooks no nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: Lord Kira wishes to shield you from the shame of your House. He has petitioned for your hand in marriage. Mika is taken aback for a moment... Turns to Kira, whose face remains placid.  38.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have agreed. But Mika is Asano’s daughter and made of sterner stuff. Thinking quickly, she quells the rising horror and rallie

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: That is most generous, my Lord...but as the Master of Protocol must himself know, tradition demands a period of mourning for my father.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: (riled) Such is not always the case. But the Shogun has come to a decision.

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: I will allow it. You are granted one year to mourn. During that time you will not be touched.... Mika revels in the small victory, until --

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-but will remain a guest of Lord Kira’s, and he the steward of your lands.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: But--

dialogues.speaker: SHOGUN
dialogues.text: You are dismissed, Lady Asano. There’s nothing more to be done. Trembling, with defeat weighing heavily on her small frame, Mika bows to the Sho and we --

dialogues.speaker: PITCH BLACK
dialogues.text: Sounds of a struggle, then -- A heavy stone LID is opened twenty feet above us. In the weak light, we can make out dank stone walls, rats scuttl in the shadows. This is the “Ako Pit” -- the worst dungeo in the province. Up above, four of Kira’s Elite Guard BEAT Oishi within an inch of his life, then HURL him down into the pit.  39. WHAM! Oishi’s body crashes to the stony floor and lays still. Laughing, the guards start sliding the dungeon lid closed, and as the dark moves in, so do the rats. The sound of the pit door closing is the sound of despair

dialogues.speaker: BOOOOM
dialogues.text: And the world is swallowed in darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright summer sun is in the sky. SUPER: “Ten months later.” The castle gate opens and Oishi -- gaunt, stooped -- is l into the blinding sunshine for the first time in a year a hurled into the mud.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: On your way, ronin! Oishi cowers in the muck, confused. He is no longer the strong, noble warrior we knew, but a broken wretch. The Guard KICKS him in the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Ronin filth! You make me sick! Out of my sight! When the guard goes to kick him again, Oishi scrambles aw like a beaten dog. He’s still grovelling when the Guard slams the gate in his face. HIGH ABOVE, from the castle’s seventh floor balcony, Kira watches Oishi weeping in the road. Deeply satisfied, he turns to one of his trusted SPIES.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: (re: Oishi) Have him watched. If he gives any sign of rebellion, cut him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oishi limps into the village...to find that everything ha CHANGED. The land has been STRIPPED and the sakura trees have all CHOPPED DOWN. The once-beautiful hills and meadows have b FURROWED into UGLY CROP FIELDS to feed Kira’s legions tha patrol the streets in number.  40. As Oishi enters the marketplace, people begin to point. T whisper. Every mouth forming the despised word: Ronin. As he passes, villagers turn away, refusing to acknowledg his now pathetic existence. The murmuring increases, unti someone shoves him from behind, knocking him into the dus Oishi turns skittishly to see a group of three VENDORS looming over him. Men he once knew. Men who respected him

dialogues.speaker: BURLY VENDOR
dialogues.text: Cowardly scum! You don’t belong here! The man SPITS on him. Another KICKS him while he’s down. The mob closes in, blows starting to really rain down whe A HAND reaches in and clutches the collar of Oishi’s robe yanking him to his feet. It’s --

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Oishi’s son turns on the crowd, wooden bokken in hand, an the crowd backs a step from his burning gaze. As the boy takes his father’s hand, Oishi looks at his so only one year older, but the eyes staring back at him are man’s eyes. Unlike his own. As the boy leads his father away from the jeering mob, RA FOCUS to Kira’s SPY, watching from a distance, satisfied Oishi is harmless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chikara leads Oishi to tinry rundown shack in the poorest section of the village. Oishi’s wife is on her knees out front, digging burdock r from the tiny garden. Clearly times have been tough. Oishi look at Chikara.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: When they took you away, they took away everything. As Oishi takes this in, Hisae looks up and sees them.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: Oishi...  41. Hisae stops like she’s been heartshot. Gasps. Trembling s hard she can’t even rise. And she cries, Oishi kneels by her side to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. OISHI’S HOUSE - NIGHT Chikara lay asleep on the floor, curled near the warmth o the brazier. Quietly, Hisae tiptoes in and removes a gently bubbling kettle from the fire. Carries it across the house to wher

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: waits. Hisae settles beside him, dipping two soft cloths the warmed water.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: All right. Oishi removes his robe...and the visual shock of his INJU steals her breath. Scars, scabs and bruises of every kind crisscross his back: puncture wounds, lacerations, burn marks; hard lumps where broken ribs have healed. Hisae is frozen by the sight of so much pain.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (gently) It’s all right, Hisae. My scars are nothing compared to what you must have endured as the wife of a ronin.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: That’s all behind us now. Blinking back tears, she begins to wash her husband's tortured body, and we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Hisae is finishing cleaning his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: ...-Lady Asano is still being held by Lord Kira. The end of her time of her mourning draws near, and Kira has arranged for them to be wed that very day. I fear for what will happen to her after.  42. Hisae wrings out her cloth, and Oishi begins to dress.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: What of my men? Hisae hesitates, fearing this line of questioning.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: Scattered to the winds. Some fought. Others protested and were cut down. Eventually all were driven off. (beat ) I heard Ryoichi now works a farm in Matsumae. Ayame says he’s happy. Hisae moves around to look in her husband's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: We could be happy. We have a second chance, Oishi, we should take it. We can leave the village tomorrow and start a new life. Watch our son become a man. Grow old together. Is that not all we need? Her smile is heartbreaking. So filled with hope... Oishi enfolds her in his arms, so she will not see the li

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Yes... She closes her eyes, burying her face in his chest and holding him tight, never wanting to let go.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: Don't widow me to an ideal, Oishi. But as we DOLLY AROUND we see the fire in Oishi’s eyes an realize for the first time that this is not a broken man. And never was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hisae wakes -- to find Oishi missing from bed. She rises from the futon and makes her way to the window where she spies her husband sitting atop a low hill in the pre-dawn dark.  43. EXT. OISHI’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER In the quiet dark, Oishi stares up at the stars, conflict emotions upon his face. Then:

dialogues.speaker: HISAE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Some of the men went to find work with the Dutch at Dejima. Oishi turns to find his wife standing there, a silk-wrapp BUNDLE in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: You'll find Hanjo there. Oishi reaches out and crushes her to his chest. After a moment she pulls away and hands him the bundle. Oishi opens it...revealing the DAGGER Lord Asano used to his own life. Oishi starts to say something, but she stops him.

dialogues.speaker: HISAE
dialogues.text: I am the wife of a samurai. Whatever your duties and obligations, they are mine, too. Oishi looks at his wife...his incredible wife...and reali she accepts what he has to do. With no words strong enough to carry the emotion, Oishi t her in his arms again.

dialogues.speaker: AND FROM THE WINDOW OF HIS ROOM
dialogues.text: Chikara watches the silhouettes of his parents against th moonlight...and knows that his father is leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathtaking in their beauty, yet... Dominating the landscape from three thousand feet up the steep snowy mountainside is Kira’s impregnable yamashiro CASTLE FORTRESS -- which looms over the world like a grim stone threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KIRA’S MOUNTAIN CASTLE - DAIMYO’S GREATHALL - CONTIN Mika stands alone at the window, a prisoner in a jail wit bars. She’s staring out at the world below, at freedom, w Lord Kira enters the room behind her. He moves close, but when she senses him, she turns and ba away in fear.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: (disappointed) All that you see from this window could be yours. Why do you resist me so? Again, he approaches her slowly, like he would a timid animal. Reaches out to stroke her face, but the moment hi black-lacquered fingernails touch her face, she SLAPS his hand away defiantly. Kira’s shock flashes to anger and he STRIKES her across t face. And just as he rears back to strike her again -- Behind them, the door opens and Kira’s Spy enters. KIRA’S SPY Lord Kira. I have word of the ronin. Kira turns on an emotional dime, his anger instantly repl by a mask of calm.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Tell me. KIRA’S SPY Oishi is broken. I’ve watched peasant farmers spit on him. Kick him. Humiliate him. There’s not an ounce of fight left in him.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: You sound disappointed. KIRA’S SPY It’s just that... The stories I have heard. He was such a great warrior. To see him like this... Kira strides to table in the center of the room holding several BONSAI TREES.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: What do you know of bonsai trees? The Spy is taken aback.  45. KIRA’S SPY I know they are beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Yes, but only as beautiful as an artist makes them. Kira picks up one of the trees -- an ugly shrub. Then tak up a pair of razor sharp shears.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Left on their own these trees grow wild and out of control. It takes the meticulous eye of an artist to see, to understand, to recognize a single branch that may mask the beauty within. A branch that left on its own would overtake the whole. Not unlike ronin. (beat) It is up to the artist to recognize this blight, for it is not until he clips that branch away -- Kira cruelly snips off a branch.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: -- that the beauty of what lies beneath is revealed. Kira turns and looks at Mika. Though he’s speaking of the tree, it’s clear he’s speaking about her.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Now, it is up to the artist to gently manipulate the remaining branches. Not to cut, but to coerce its shape. To coax it. To train it. Kira grabs a branch and bends it down, using a piece of t to tie it down. He considers it for a second, then sets t tree aside. Takes another from the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Slowly. Steadily. With increasing pressure so that in time, with patience, the branch eventually ceases to resist the artist’s desires... Kira releases a branch that has been tied -- and it stays position.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: And the work is complete.  46. Kira considers the tree with a critical eye. Then turns t Mika and does the same.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: In the end the tree succumbs. It is a truth. (pointedly) And it is inevitable. And off Mika's frightened expression, we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KIRA’S FORTRESS - LORD’S CHAMBERS - MOMENTS LATER Kira enters and shuts the door behind him. A SHADOWY FIGU stands with his back to us at the edge of the balcony overlooking the thousand foot drop below.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Thank you for waiting. The figure nods almost imperceptibly. As Kira angles arou we get a better look at the man. Tall, stacked with corde muscle. Dressed in a traditional ninjutsu outfit so dark it is almost back. A mask across the lower half of his fa conceals his identity and leaves only his EYES exposed -- eyes that burn with an intelligence and remorselessness t chills our blood. The NINJA CLANLORD is quite possibly the most imposing fi this side of the Shogun.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wish to hire your ninja clan to deal with the ronin. Oishi in particular. The Clanlord’s voice is the unfathomable crack and rumble deep-earth coal being crushed to diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: NINJA CLANLORD
dialogues.text: Did I not just overhear your spy say he was broken? There’s a smirk in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: I have not gotten to where I am without taking precaution. Kira tosses a heavy purse of gold kobans to him. Only the Ninja Lord’s hand moves, snatching it out of the air like snake grabbing a bird in flight.  47.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will this cover your expense?

dialogues.speaker: NINJA CLANLORD
dialogues.text: (weighing the bag) For now.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: There can be no evidence. I need you to make them disappear.

dialogues.speaker: NINJA CLANLORD
dialogues.text: My Lord -- (mock bows ) That is what we do best. And the Clanlord steps off the balcony, plummeting into t abyss. Kira rushes to the edge...but sees only the thousand foot drop below. The Clanlord has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: NAGASAKI BAY
dialogues.text: A bustling port city surrounds Nagasaki’s gorgeous harbor But floating in the middle of the Bay FIND:

dialogues.speaker: DEJIMA ISLAND
dialogues.text: A small, ARTIFICIAL ISLAND built as a trading outpost for Dutch. The fan-shaped islet is kept separate from the mainland by a LONG STONE BRIDGE -- Japan’s equivalent of proverbial “ten-foot-pole” to keep foreigners from ever touching Japanese soil. Despite looks from the locals --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: crosses the quarter-mile span of stone and steps onto the island. Speaks to the first man he finds, a Japanese LABO in ridiculous Western clothes.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I need to speak to the man in charge. The Laborer nods and motions for Oishi to follow.  48. Now TRACK WITH OISHI as he is led across the synthetic island. Though a CLAUSTROPHOBIC MAZE of cargo crates and livestock. Past laborers struggling to unload the two Dut East-India MERCHANT SHIPS moored there: the 18 sail “Dolphijn” and the enormous “Rotterdam”. POV - OISHI: scanning each worker's face as he passes, searching for signs of his men. All the laborers are Japanese, clad in the cornflower blue coats of the Dutch, to aman, they are gaunt, dejected, STRUNG OUT. As they pass the open door of a warehouse, Oishi sees why The interior of one structure has been converted into an OPIUM DEN. Inside, scores of Japanese workmen lay in a stupor, inhaling their pay. They are slaves kept not in chains of steel, but wisps of opium smoke. Oishi notes HANJO and several other men are among them. Reaching the office, Oishi is motioned to wait as his gui disappears inside. A moment later, he reappears.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: The Kapitan will see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark and filled with the blue-gray haze of tobacco smoke. Oishi nearly thinks he’s alone...until the bowl of a pipe GLOWS CHERRY RED as someone in the shadows takes a long draw. We can almost make out the man’s features --huge and unre but then the dark closes in once again.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: You look as though you have travelled far. The voice is harsh and startling as an anchor chain clank The man fills two sake cups and pushes one forward.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Here... Slake your thirst. Oishi sips. The Kapitan downs his.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: So..you have come for work?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I have come to collect my men.  49.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Your men? (mulls this) You are samurai, then? Under which lord do you serve? Oishi says no more. The Kapitan laughs, refilling his gla

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Ah... So you are ronin. You Japanese are a funny people. Distorting honor until it is a perversion beyond recognition. Oishi ignores the slight and the Kapitan downs his drink.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: The problem is this: your men came here willingly to work, but they’ve accrued many debts during their time here.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I will pay.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: How? Oishi removes his sword from his belt and places it reverently on the table. The Kapitan’s hands reach out from the dark; monstrous gr crusted paws covered in ROPE SCARS and SAILOR TATTOOS. So big, it’s hard to believe they’re human. The Kapitan clicks the scabbard open to examine the blade a ceremonial work of art, razor sharp. He runs his thumb along the edge until a DROP OF BLOOD trickles down the bl Then he slams the sword back in its sheath and sets it ba on the table.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Done! In Rotterdam, we drink to a deal. The Kapitan fills both their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Kampai. Oishi downs his sake.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: And now you will get my men.  50. The room glows red as the Kapitan takes another draw on h pipe, and this time we glimpse his EYES -- two cruel chip soulless blue sea ice.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Will I? Oishi rises...but suddenly feels UNSTEADY.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: You Japanese... The arrogance is staggering. I mean, here you sit, despised by your own people, unwanted, unhireable...and yet you presume to give me orders. Oishi collapses forward as the world TILTS CRAZILY. And w horror he realizes he’s been DRUGGED.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: You forget yourself, ronin. We may not be allowed to step foot onto Japanese soil without risking our entire shipping operation, but the blade cuts both ways. This is Dutch land. You can almost hear the bastard grinning. Oishi goes for his sword -- but the table EXPLODES UP, th across the room as easily as a toy. Oishi stumbles back and watches in horror as the Kapitan steps into the light. The man is enormous. An eight-foot bearded hulk, stacked with the heavy, unnatural muscle on the sea can give. This is why they call the Dutch “barbarians”. The Kapitan makes Conan look like a sissy kid brother. Oishi’s sword lay at his feet. He moves for it, but the Dutch giant’s hand snatches out and grips him by the coll Lifts him as easily as a child -- awesome strength -- the HURLS him across the room! WHAM! Oishi SMASHES against the wall and slams to the flo POV OISHI: As the Giant stomps toward him, the world turn SURREAL from the drugs. Oishi tries to crawl to his sword, but the Kapitan grabs by his topknot and SMASHES him -- CRRRAAAASH! -- into his desk with enough force to SHATTER it to kindling. And then the Dutchman lifts him up, CHOKING HIM to death. Oishi struggles as the bastard laughs, and just as the li are about to go out forever --  51. OISHI’S FINGERS close on a WICKED SPLINTER from the shatt desk -- ten inches long and deadly sharp -- and STABS it through his collar bone and DEEP into his trunk.

dialogues.speaker: GRRAAAAAUGHH
dialogues.text: The barbarian captain roars in pain and HURLS him with en force to SNAP the wall boards. Hearing his cry, another giant DUTCH OFFICER races in, WHEELLOCK PISTOL out and ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: KAPITAN
dialogues.text: Shoot him! The Officer pulls the trigger, but in the blink of an eye Oishi grasps his sword and whips the blade out of its scabbard -- AND RIGHT BETWEEN THE CAP AND THE POWDER! The gun clicks harmlessly and, as the confused Officer stares, trying to figure out what just happened, Oishi la the blade up and BISECTS HIS ENORMOUS HEAD. Making his move, Oishi staggers out of the room, the Kapi roaring behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OISHI’'S POV: The drugs hit FULL-EFFECT and reality slips into a WHORLING NIGHTMARE LANDSCAPE. As GARGANTUAN DUTCHMEN come running to aid their Kapitan, Oishi ducks into the labyrinth of cargo crates, making hi way toward where he last saw his men. BACK IN THE KAPITAN’S OFFICE - the Dutch leader BUSTS OPE the ARMS CHEST and starts handing out weaponry to his men PISTOLS, CUTLASSES, CURTAL AXES...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO OISHI
dialogues.text: Making his way through the maze when -- Suddenly, TWO DUTCHMEN race around the corner. The one wi the pistol FIRES, but Oishi reacts instantly, whipping th flat of his blade up as a narrow, VERTICAL SHIELD and bra with both hands as -- SPANGGG! -- the bullet RICOCHETS OF  52. As he tries to reload, Dutchman #2 ROARS DEFIANTLY and CHARGES with a naval cutlass -- but as he swings, Oishi S THE BLADE DOWN with the flat of his left hand and HACKS T MAN'S HEAD FROM HIS SHOULDERS with his right. No time to reload, the Pistoleer flips the gun around to as a club. When he swings, Oishi HALF-STEPS BACK and the butt of the pistol SWISHES PAST his face to OBLITERATE a wooden crate! Oishi then HALF-STEPS FORWARD and separates the titan’s a from the rest of his body. Oishi continues on, arriving at --

dialogues.speaker: THE OPIUM DEN
dialogues.text: A Dutch attendant rises -- but then falls back as his leg are HEWN from his trunk. Myth blends with reality as Oishi moves through, DRAGONS SMOKE swirling around the room. Dozens of Japanese lay everywhere in an opium stupor. Fallen samurai, ruined geishas. Oishi finds HANJO laying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (shaking him) Hanjo! Hanjo opens his eyes, struggling to rise from his narcosi

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: Oishi... You came. They made me... They made--

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I know. Where are the others? Hanjo points to a BACK ROOM. But suddenly -- BLAM! -- a pistol ball flips the collar of Oishi’s kimono, so close actually SINGES the silk. Oishi turns on the GUNMAN standing in the doorway, then springs forward and LANCES the man through the heart so f we almost miss it. Then he’s back by Hanjo’s side.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: We have to go. Now. Oishi hefts Hanjo to his feet and races into the back roo just as the Kapitan and his men storm the den.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lockdown for problem slaves... With pistol balls thunking into the wood around them, Ois slams the heavy door closed behind them. Instantly, two Dutchmen rise, one brandishing a pistol, b before he can get off a shot, Oishi slices up, CHOPPING O the man’s hand with the pistol -- which Hanjo GRABS OUT O MID-AIR and FIRES POINT BLANK into the face of giant #2. Stopping #1’s screams with a nonchalant cut, Oishi turns find ten of his men secured to the wall by CHAINS around their necks. Oishi’s men can’t believe their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Blademaster. .? Oishi CLEAVES the wood beam their chain runs through, FRE them all.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR
dialogues.text: the Dutch giants BATTER at the wood as the Kapitan watche in a fury.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE
dialogues.text: Oishi sees the wood grain in the door begin to separate. There’s no escape. No time left. One of the older ronin, OKUDA, kneels before Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: OKUDA
dialogues.text: Let us at least die with honor. And he exposes his neck for a clean strike. Oishi conside Then raises his sword high and CLEAVES DOWN! But not through Okuda’s neck. Through the FLOORPLANKS to CRAWLSPACE below.
