dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You have duty yet to fulfill, samurai.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR
dialogues.text: The Dutch use all their might and CRASH THROUGH THE DOOR just in time to see Oishi disappearing down the rabbit ho  54. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM!! They unload a hellfire of pistols, but t ronin are already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squealing wave of rats comes surging from beneath the building, followed by Oishi and his men.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Run for the dock! Let nothing stop you! And as a swarm of Dutchmen race around the corner, Oishi turns and dispatches them while the ronin run. Oishi is J the Giant Killer, cutting down hulking barbarians and buy time for his men -- until the Kapitan rages forward with sixty armed men. Then Oishi, too, turns and runs, cutting a rope that secu a stack of cargo which comes TUMBLING DOWN, CRUSHING one their enemies and HAMPERING the pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oishi and his men run, a hailstorm of lead ripping past a they charge out onto the dock -- a quarter-mile of stone standing between them and freedom. BEHIND THEM, the Dutch begin to gain. Firing. Firing. WITH OISHI AND HIS MEN RUNNING ACROSS THE DOCK - as bulle start finding their marks. One ronin’s head EXPLODES. Another is GUTSHOT and falls behind. Hanjo goes down with bullet in his thigh -- but Oishi is there, hefting him up RACING DOWN THE FINAL STRETCH. THE DUTCH try to reload while they chase, but give up, drawing KNIVES and CUTLASSES instead. Pouring on the stea

dialogues.speaker: GAINING UNTIL THE KAPITAN IS ONLY FEET AWAY --
dialogues.text: And just as he hauls back to bury his cutlass in Oishi’s skull -- Oishi DIVES, dragging Hanjo with him...onto Japanese soil The Dutch skid to a stop at the end of the dock, millimet from crossing the line. Oishi stares up from the ground at his pursuers, breathin hard, separated by an invisible wall. Safe. The Kapitan stares hatefully at Oishi, a seething inferno impotent fury. With a roar, he reaches into his shoulder pulls out the wicked spike -- nearly a foot of bloody woo and casts it aside.  55. Then, as he and his men retreat back down the dock, Oishi slumps exhausted to the ground, and we--

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL CAMPFIRE
dialogues.text: The survivors from Dejima have camped in a wooded spot fo the night. All of the men are sleeping, save for Hanjo, w shivers mercilessly from opium withdrawl. Oishi lifts a small bubbling pot from the fire.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Here. Drink this. With trembling hands, Hanjo does.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: (ashamed) Look at me...

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I do. In pride.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: What is there to be proud of? I am weak. Even now I crave the opium, Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: The opium craves itself. And that will pass. (beat) But the man I see before me was willing to sacrifice all, to reduce himself beyond what is endurable without thought for himself, in the hopes of one day returning honor to his lord’s name. (beat) No, the man I see before me...humbles me by his example of bushido. Oishi bows his head and Hanjo lets the moment infuse him, settle into the deep steel of his soul. Strengthen him.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: So how can I help?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (VO)
dialogues.text: These are the names of all the Ako samurai.

dialogues.speaker: HILLTOP
dialogues.text: Oishi draws his tanto...and SLICES it through a LIST OF N he holds before him. He severs the paper into eight equal portions, then hands one out to each man.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: All must be contacted. The men bow. But only Hanjo does not have a list. He turn to Oishi, empty handed.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: But what of me? I am able -- Oishi quiets him with a gesture, then withdraws SMALL SCR from his robe. Presses it into Hanjo’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Find him.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: As the SUN and MUSIC both RISE dramatically, Oishi and hi ronin strike off in all eight directions of the compass. Now INTERCUT between: -- ISOGAI traveling along a mountain path, seasonal rains making for slow going. -- OKUDA trekking through a land of hot springs -- HANJO making his way along the coast to a seaport village. SMASH TO: -- EXT. A PEACEFUL RIVER. One of Asano’s older samurai, HAZAMA (68) now sits in a boat as a peasant, using a pet CORMORANT on a leash to catch sweetfish. When he rows in, is surprised to find Oishi waiting for him...

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: It is time. -- INT. SUMO STABLE. Two beheamoth rikishi (wrestlers) collide with a titanic clash. The larger of the two is BASHO, one of Asano’s ronin. They struggle mightily...unt Basho sees ISOGAI watching in the doorway. Isogai flashes Lord Asano’s FAMILY CREST and Basho ROARS, pitching his opponent out of the ring with superhuman strength to end bout... -- And as HANJO pays for passage aboard a ship to cross t sea...  57. -- A DRUNKARD in a bar gulps down his sake...only to find Asano'’s CREST at the bottom of his glass. He turns to lo and finds OKUDA beside him... -- A BEGGAR squats at a bridge calling for alms when Asan CREST clinks into his donation blanket. He touches it and looks up...to see ISOGAI before him... -- LABORERS straining to lift giant stones against a slop for the foundation of a castle when BASHO appears. Three familiar faces instantly drop what they’re doing and move him. .. -- In China, HANJO speaks to a Mercenary Officer, who tie Oishi’s scroll onto the leg of a hawk and urges the bird skyward... -- A MONK is in meditation outside his temple. When he opens his eyes, he is surprised to see ASANO’S CREST befo him. -- Ina sapling forest, a group of BRIGANDS spring from concealment to rob a traveller...only to find the travell is HAZAMA bearing Asano’s CREST. The Brigand Chief, one o Asano’s principal retainers, kneels and weeps at Hazama’s feet. -- Ina rice paddy, a FARMER and his WIFE are harvesting knee-deep in muck when a shadow falls over them. It’s Ois

dialogues.speaker: SKIMMING ABOVE CHINA
dialogues.text: We’re on a visual rollercoaster ride FOLLOWING the falcon it navigates the wild air currents over Mongol China. We wheel through the sail rigging of junks on the river, the barely skim over the top of the Great Wall -- -- to REVEAL a MASSIVE DUST CLOUD where an EPIC BATTLE is underway. In no time, we fly into it. ARROWS fly past like a steel- tipped rainstorm. The falcon doesn’t care, dipping down into the carnage wh we see a company of MERCENARIES battling against the MONG HORDES. We fly just overhead, the machinery of war turning men in mincemeat, until the falcon spots what it’s looking for: STANDARD of the merc company. Dodging crazily through sword swipes and speartips, the falcon makes it to the STANDARD BEARER and lands on his shoulder.  58. The man glances at SCROLL the falcon carries, then runs forward to find --

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: at the heart of the hottest fighting. The man is a tirele whirlwind of destruction, letting his two swords unleash the anger he’s ever felt over his ignoble birth, the loss Mika. He takes out one Mongol with an ankle-severing stri known as Harvesting Rice, then two more in an acrobatic maneuver called Mantis Catches the Fly. At a momentary break in the battle, the Standard Bearer r up to Minoru.

dialogues.speaker: STANDARD BEARER
dialogues.text: A message! Minoru takes the scroll. Cracks the seal and reads the pa within. It reads: It is time. It’s signed by Oishi. As Minoru looks at the paper, BEHIND HIM a GIGANTIC

dialogues.speaker: NEANDERTHAL MONGOL RISES UP
dialogues.text: Seeing him too late, the Standard Bearer panics as the Mo swings his GREAT DIRE AXE -- But Minoru turns and dispatches the giant with a casual swipe. Then SHEATHES his swords.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: I am needed. And Minoru begins to WALK AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: STANDARD BEARER
dialogues.text: What?! Where do you think you’re going?! Minoru! And just like that, he walks away from the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea fog has rolled in from the coast, lending the momen serene, spiritual feel. Oishi kneels before Lord Asano’s grave in prayer. The kni with which young Asano took his own life sits with honor small length of silk before him.  59. Quiet footsteps behind him bring him from meditation.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: Sir... The men have gathered. But when Oishi opens his eyes, there is a curious look on Hanjo’s face.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: There are less than expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oishi quickly makes his way down the foggy path toward th temple. The glow of many lanterns blaze through the mist ahead. Oishi mounts the temple steps and ascends --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: And where he expects to find Asano’s three-hundred-and-fi loyal samurai warriors, fully-armed and ready to restore their Lord’s name to glory -- He is shocked to find only forty-three... Oishi stares at the men, a quarter of them in their fifti and sixties. One of them, HORIBE, is even in his late seventies. And there isn’t a stitch of steel between them.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Where are the others? Oishi stands momentarily dumbfounded. A man awaking from dream of heaven...only to find himself in hell. Finally, an elderly warrior (CHUZAEMON) speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: CHUZAEMON
dialogues.text: We were once 350 strong. Now look at us.

dialogues.speaker: MURAMATSU KIMURA
dialogues.text: We're only 45. You promised us honor, Oishi!

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: We should have fought! What good are we now?  60. The moment turns quiet. Despairing. Nearby, Sujo’s FALCON ruffles its feathers, sending a sno downy underfeathers to the temple floor. Oishi steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: What good are we now? Oishi extends his arm and takes the bird from Sujo. Remov its hood.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Look at this falcon. Powerful. Proud. Utterly without fear. His skill at flying makes him the unmatched hunter in the sky. (beat) Yet despite the thousands of feathers that cover the falcon’s body...only twenty give it flight. Oishi swings his arm, casting the falcon into the air whe it BEATS THE AIR POWERFULLY with its wings, SOARING back Sujo. It settles on his wrist with a proud, noble shriek. There’s real power in the moment. Each man stares at the bird...then turns back to Oishi, who meets every one of t eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: You are the ones that came back. You are the strongest, most loyal samurai of the Asano clan. Will you fight with me? There is a beat as every man searches his soul, the decis hanging in the balance until --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0S)
dialogues.text: I will fight. Everyone turns to see MINORU stride into the chamber. His time in the mercenary company has hardened him. Honed him He is a serious warrior now. The campaigneer meets the gaze of every man in the room, challenging.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: I may not be samurai, but I owe everything that I am to Lord Asano...and I’m willing to give my life if I can help you avenge his death.  61. One by one, the others stand. The tide turns and soon everyone has risen. Oishi looks at the forty-six loyal men standing before hi ranging in age from 24 to 77 -- all willing to die for wh they believe in. It’s not nearly enough... But they will have to make do.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Then we are forty-six united.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0S)
dialogues.text: Forty-seven. Oishi turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: -- entering the ring of men. The sixteen-year-old moves t stand before his father; a boy on the precipice of manhoo

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Asano was my Lord as well. Oishi considers his son’s words... Then suddenly HURLS a sword at him lightning fast! Chikar CATCHES the blade by the hilt with ease. In his RIGHT hand. Oishi meets his son’s eyes with respect...and nods.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (with finality) Then if the gods will it...we shall fight as forty-seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many of the men are still talking, catching up. Others sleep. Oishi is sitting beside a small fire, contemplatin his son who dozes peacefully nearby, when Minoru quietly walks over and sits down. Minoru speaks quietly so as not to wake the boy.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: (re: Chikara) He’s grown.  62.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: So have you. You look like Hachiman.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: I feel like him. Ancient. Eternally exhausted. Oishi looks at Minoru, genuine mirth touches his features

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: It is good to see you again, Minoru. The two fall into a peaceful silence. But it cannot last dissolves into more serious matters at hand.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Lady Asano?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (nods ) Alive. Minoru reads between the lines.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: What aren’t you telling me?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: She is to be married to Kira on the eve of the new moon. We sense it takes every ounce of iron control Minoru has keep from going after her that very second.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Then how shall we proceed?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: To fight a war, an army needs two things: fire in its belly and steel in its hand... The first we have. (dramatic beat) Now it’s time to get the latter. And as the two men meet eyes, HARD CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: with an image carved in relief. Carefully, an ARTISAN coa the surface with ink, then presses a large canvas against creating an amazing WOODBLOCK PRINT of Mt. Fuji at sunris seen from a busy marketplace at Edo.  63. Now TILT UP from the canvas to reveal the exact same image...but this time it’s real. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Artisan’s quarter. Metalsmiths’ Alley, specifically. Chikara wanders through in wonder. Past Isogai who critically examines a sword maker’s wares. Then on past another stall where Minoru is doing the same -- until his catches on something in particular. Minoru lifts a smooth white cube from the table.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: How much for the block of ivory?

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Set it down, halfbreed. We don’t sell to your kind. But Minoru is used to this. Simply pulls his entire coin belt and sets it down. Ten times what the thing is worth. Everything he’s ever saved. The vendor stares at the money...and his prejudice is overcome by practical greed.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it and go. And don’t tell anyone where you bought it! Chikara continues on, to where he hears his father ahead.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (0S)
dialogues.text: And these are your best fighting pieces? Chikara joins his father at a swordsmith’s stall, where O is inspecting a regal-looking katana.

dialogues.speaker: SWORDMAKER
dialogues.text: The highest quality in all Edo. Officially recognized by the Emperor. Working the bellows in the rear of the stall, an elderly ARMED AINU (an aboriginal Japanese) CHUCKLES at the Swordmaker’s sales pitch. The guy is 80 if he’s a day and has a beard to his navel. The Swordmaker throws an irritated glance to shut him up, tries to continue.  64. SWORDMAKER (CONT’D) Examine the detail of the scrollwork. So delicate. So beautiful -- In response, the Ainu blows his nose like a trumpet, usin his dirty beard as a Kleenex, and laughs like a madman. The Swordmaker has had enough, hurling a handful of iron tsuba at the toothless old man. SWORDMAKER (CONT’D) I’1ll teach you to cackle, you filthy dung monkey! The Ainu skitters back into the shadows. As the Swordmake goes to chase him away, Chikara picks up the regal sword.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: These are the ones we are looking for, right, Father? They are beautiful blades.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: And nothing more. Chikara is confused. Oishi takes the beautiful blade from his hands and explains patiently. A good teacher. A great father.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The steel tells all. Ifa swordmaker is lazy and folds the metal only a handful of times, the carbon doesn’t get distributed and the iron remains soft. Oishi presses on the sword edge with his thw --

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Careful, Father! -- but rather than cut him, the metal BENDS like butter. sight impresses Chikara...but affects Oishi in a deeper w

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: How many samurai have been sent to their deaths with a weapon like this in their hands? (shakes his head sadly) Terrible... Oishi slides the blade back into its scabbard just as the Swordmaker returns.  65.

dialogues.speaker: SWORDMAKER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about that foul creature. Now, let us back to business --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Clearly you are a master swordmaker...but I’m afraid this is far beyond what we could afford. (bows humbly) I thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: SWORDMAKER
dialogues.text: Thank me in future by not wasting it! As Oishi continues down the line of stalls, Chikara’s attention is drawn to a commotion down the alley. Three brash samurai -- Noto HARES from their armor -- mak their way through the street, shouting drunkenly and shar slapping people aside with the flat of their blades.

dialogues.speaker: HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: Move, you louts! Merchants and customers scramble to get out of their way. they near the stall where Chikara stands, the leader of t Hares turns to a pretty FRUIT VENDOR GIRL in her stall.

dialogues.speaker: HARE LEADER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are hungry. Have you any winter melons?

dialogues.speaker: FRUIT VENDOR GIRL
dialogues.text: No, my lords --

dialogues.speaker: NOTO HARE
dialogues.text: Lies! She hides them here! #1 suddenly grabs her and tears her silk robes open, expo her generous bosom. NOTO HARE #1 (CONT’D) I ask you, are those not melons?! The men laugh as she struggles to cover up, and #1 is giv her breasts a rough squeeze when the HARE LEADER turns an sees Chikara staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: Is there a problem, peasant? Chikara hesitates. Knows he shouldn’t say anything, but -

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Yes. There is.  66. The Hares stop and turn on Chikara, who doesn’t back an i

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Samurai are supposed to protect their people, not prey upon them.

dialogues.speaker: NOTO HARE
dialogues.text: How dare you speak so insolently to your betters!

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: I see no betters before me. There’s a dangerous moment. The Leader steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: The farmer's got a little pluck in him. (turns to Hare #2) Cut it out. Hare #2 draws his sword with relish, and as he goes to sl Chikara with the flat of the blade -- And in that instant, Chikara’s instinct overrules all rational thought. Completely on reflex, Chikara sidesteps the blow and trap-locks the sword out of #2'’s hands. Bef the Hares can blink, the sword is now in Chikara’s hands - WHAMMM!! -- he smashes #2 across the face with it. Teeth go flying and #2 drops like a felled tree. All this happens within a single heartbeat. The Hares look at one another -- this is no simple farmer Now the Leader draws his weapons, two double daggers know RABBIT’S TEETH, and springs at Chikara, unleashing an INT FLURRY OF BLOWS. Chikara stumbles back, surprised by the speed and ferocit the strikes. Chikara blocks, but quickly finds himself so overwhelmed by the onslaught... ...that he makes a fatal mistake and INSTINCTIVELY SWITCH HIS SWORD TO HIS DOMINANT LEFT HAND.

dialogues.speaker: THE HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: sees opening and as he moves to deliver the death blow -- CLACKK! The Hare Leader’s dual blades are blocked by a WALKING STICK.  67. The Leader whips around -- to confront a man standing bef him. OISHI. There’s a moment...then the Leader recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: Ronin..! All around, thirty ears perk up at the word. Instantly, Oishi and his men go for weapons, ready to fight -- but t Hares do what they what they do best and TAKE OFF RUNNING alert their daimyo. Oishi turns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: If they get away, our plans are doomed. Without another word, Hanjo and Isogai take off after Not Hare #1, while Oishi and Minoru follow the Hare Leader, leaving Chikara alone in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: THE HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: Trained as a runner since birth, the Leader sprints throu the maze of Edo streets, desperately fast, rounding corne leaping off walls, shoving anyone to the ground who gets his way. MINORU does his best to stay on his heels, but the bastar unbelievably fast. OISHI quickly realizes he won’t be able to keep up, and u his brain instead of his feet, cutting down an adjacent alleyway, hoping to get ahead of the chase while --

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: is in hot pursuit of Noto Hare #1. As nearly 60-year-old Hanjo starts to wheeze and fall back, Isogai calls out --

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, old man, I’ve got it! And Isogai takes off at speed, the entire hopes of the 47 ronin resting on his shoulders. Hare #1 runs like a rabbit before the hounds. Were he not drunk, he would certainly leave Isogai in the dust, but h legs have lost their split-second timing and fleetness. And Isogai is gaining.  68. Watching his pursuer over his shoulder more than the way ahead, Hare #1 rounds a corner -- and finds himself in a end alley. But just when we think he’1ll stop, he doesn’t -- and run straight for the alley wall! With every ounce of speed he can muster he LEAPS at the stones and REBOUNDS off them, sailing over the head of Isogai and toward freedom --!! But Isogai reaches up and grabs a foot as he passes -- an SLAMS him down to the earth. WHAM!! Now a desperate scrabble ensues, Hare #1 wielding his dou short swords like steel incisors. Isogai and he grapple o the ground, but the Hare’s moves are blazingly fast and h armored. Isogai’s attempts to harm him are thwarted by th steel and slowly, the fight turns. Hare #1 gets the upper hand, double blades poised above Isogai’s chest, and just he’s about to stab down -- TWO ELDERLY HANDS reach into frame, grip Hare #1’s helm a WRENCH IT VIOLENTLY AROUND -- KRRRAAAACCKK! -- BREAKING h neck. Hare #1 drops, boneless as a doll, and Isogai looks up at savior. HANJO stands there.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: (pointedly) Old man?

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: I’m never going to hear the end of this, am I? Hanjo just smiles and we SLAM BACK TO--

dialogues.speaker: THE NOTO HARE LEADER
dialogues.text: racing through the streets, Minoru hot on his heels. He tries to lose his pursuer by taking a shortcut beneath a building on stilts -- -- to find his only means of escape BLOCKED as OISHI’s sh fills the exit. The Leader turns to double back, but now Minoru blocks that way as well. The Hare Leader's eyes flick back and forth wildly. He’s trapped. And as Oishi and Minoru draw their weapons and start closing in for the kill in perfect synchronicity, t Leader sighs, knowing he’s well and truly fucked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chikara stands at the Fruit Vendor Girl’s stall making su she’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Are you certain you are all right? She refuses to make eye contact. A moment later, her FATH steps up and pushes Chikara away. Glares at him. GIRL’S FATHER You aren't welcome here. Your kind only brings trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. I came to your aid -- GIRL’S FATHER You are ronin. You are a disgrace. Nothing you do will ever change that. (beat) Now go. Shocked, Chikara looks around...and sees the entire marketplace FOCUSED on him. Looks of disdain. Anger. Hatred. And for the first time for Chikara, what it truly means t ronin hits home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five ronin have regathered. Minoru sits beneath a tre carving the block of ivory he bought. In the b.g., Hanjo Isogai dump the bodies of the slain Hares in the river. Now PAN OVER TO REVEAL Chikara sitting on a rock, removed from the group. After a moment, Oishi approaches his son. Sits beside him Neither says a word, until finally --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (quietly) Listen, Chikara... The only advantage we have against Kira, the only possible chance, is by means of surprise. They must continue to think we are broken and not a threat. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You weren’t thinking. You must suppress your pride. There will be a time to fight. This is not it. Humiliated, Chikara looks up at his father.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Do you wish me to go home? Oishi considers...then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: No. We are only 47. We cannot afford to lose a single blade... Chikara bows his head in shame as Oishi rises and strides off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minoru walks beside Chikara, who is drowning in a sea of doubt.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: I am so...ashamed. Minoru looks him in the eye. Man to man.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Then redeem yourself.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: But, I’m cursed. No matter how hard I try to suppress it, my left hand is dominant. If not for my father intervening back there... Chikara doesn’t finish the thought. It’s too terrible.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: You mustn’t dwell on what’s past.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: That’s easy for you to say. My father respects you.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Perhaps...but the rest of the world does not. And never will. (beat) My whole life I have known that I can never be a samurai...but that hasn’t prevented me from living as though I could.  71. Chikara looks up at Minoru.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: You must take what you think holds you back and find a way to turn it into a strength.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: But how?

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: You are your father’s son. You’ll figure it out. There is kindness in Minoru’s look. And strength. It’s ju the salve for Chikara’s wounded pride. Minoru walks away, and as Chikara processes what he’s said -- SFX: SOMEONE GIGGLES BEHIND CHIKARA. Chikara turns to look...but sees no one there. Chikara continues walking -- and stops short when the MAD GIGGLING recommences. He spins around, and this time he s the ONE-ARMED AINU tottering after him, almost upon him.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: .-hee-hee...i know who you are...hee-hee...I know what you’re looking for... As the toothless old vagabond nears him, Chikara backs aw in panic and trips, falling flat on his ass. The Ainu descends on him, greasy beard falling in Chikara’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --.i know...iknowiknowiknow.. heeheeeheeeee...

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: Aaauughh! In an instant, Oishi and the others are there. Hanjo uses the point of his sword to back the Ainu away.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: Leave him be, old one! But even then, the wizened creature can only giggle.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: I know who you are! Lord Asano’s men! Lord Asano’s ronin come looking for weapons. Minoru and the others look to Oishi, concerned.  72.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Should I kill him?

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: Kill me? When I’m the only one in the city who knows how to find good blades, real blades, instead of these...ornaments. He spits out the last word with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Where? The Ainu begins coughing theatrically, leaning heavily on walking staff.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: So dry out today, is it not? A man can hardly...(cough, cough)...clear his throat to speak. A little drink would ease my--

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Answer him, you little beggar!

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Isogai.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: The tavern is not far. Out of town. Away from trouble. Away from pesky little rabbits. The Ainu indicates behind Oishi with his eyes. Oishi turn and sees two Noto Hares walking down the road.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: (turning back to the Ainu) Lead us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oishi’s men sit around as the One-Armed Ainu loudly finis a bowl of soup and uses his beard as a napkin. But when h signals for a refill of his sake cup, Isogai explodes.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Why are we wasting our time?! He knows nothing! He’s simply trying to beg sake off us!  73. But before Isogai has finished his rant, the old man slid his walking stick apart to reveal THE MOST BEAUTIFUL EXAM OF SWORDMAKING WE HAVE EVER SEEN. Even Minoru, completely engrossed in carving his ivory bl looks up in wonder. In his hands, the Ainu holds a DOUBLE-EDGED KATANA, polis mirror bright. Like liquid silver. A steel dream... Words choke in Isogai’s throat. Oishi stares in open astonishment at the quality.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Koto blade... From the reverence in his tone, we can tell it’s the Holy Grail of swordmaking.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How. .?

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: The rest of Japan may have forgotten the true art of swordmaking...but the Ainu have not. And_ as the old man begins to tell the story, PUSH IN on coals in the brazier on the table and --

dialogues.speaker: A RIVER OF FLOWING LAVA
dialogues.text: -- snaking beneath the earth. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where we FOLLOW the lava flow through a maze of VOLCAN TUNNELS formed of solidified molten rock. Orange light suffuses the tunnels, making them glow. From somewhere ahead, and the sound of SMITHS’ HAMMERS can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU, (VO)
dialogues.text: Frustrated at the deterioration of the swordmaking art, the descendants of legendary swordmaker Amakuni retreated into the lava tunnels beneath Mt. Fuji to rediscover their ancestor’s lost techniques.  74. Now we round a bend in the tunnel and enter Hell’s Foundr an awesome chamber of stalactites and stalagmites where a army of ONI (fierce Japanese demons) work iron into steel using bubbling calderas of lava as their furnace.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU, (VO)
dialogues.text: Down there in the dark, they used the earth as their forge. With no sun to tell the time, the swordmakers worked relentlessly, day and night, caring only for their craft, their bodies changing, becoming muscled from the hammer, their skin baked red as kiln bricks from the unending heat, their eyes seared milky white from staring at the glow of molten metal. CLOSE IN on the largest of the Oni as he pulls a GIGANTIC BLADE from a lava pot. It glows cherry red as he places i on an iron deposit and raises a MASSIVE HAMMER to shape i

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU, (VO)
dialogues.text: (beat) But all that mattered was the sword. The Oni SMASHES the hammer down with the force of a god. CLAAAANGG! An EXPLOSION OF SPARKS burst from the metal, a we --

dialogues.speaker: THE BRAZIER, (INT. TAVERN)
dialogues.text: -- as the Ainu pokes the coals and sparks fly. The tale has spellbound Oishi’s men. All except Isogai, w rolls his eyes at the theatrics.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: The price for the blades is two- fold. The first is your silence. If the Emperor were to discover the swordmakers, he would claim them and the art would be lost forever.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: And what is the second?

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: Gold. Fifty kobans apiece. Everyone reacts. Shocked. Outraged. Isogai physically stumbles back from the figure.  75.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU HANJO
dialogues.text: What?! Are you joking?!

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: I have heard enough! The man is clearly a thief, Oishi! No one makes koto blades anymore, the secrets are gone. The blade is too pretty. It would never stand up in battle battle. It’s a fake! At that, the Ainu rises.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: If it is a fake, then strike me down.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Watch your words, old man. I’m tempted to do just that!

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: Then strike at me. (beat) If you do not, then I will. (beat ) Strike me! When Isogai hesitates, the Ainu moves lightning fast, snatching up his sword with his lone arm and ATTACKING! Isogai reacts on decades of hard-drilled instinct, parryi the blow -- CRAAANG! -- then CHOPPING the Ainu across the middle, cleaving him in two!

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: You should not have struck at me, old man. I regret that I had to kill you. But the Ainu doesn’t fall. And instead, starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-ARMED AINU
dialogues.text: And I regret that you are in error. You’ve done me no harm. At this, the Ainu straightens and we see he’s completely unharmed. Isogai gapes in awe...until he sees his blade laying on the ground, SHATTERED. He’s been standing there like an idiot, holding only the handle of his sword. And the Ainu’s sword is untouched. Not a nick on it. Nothing. Oishi turns to him. And smiles.  76.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: We'll take 47.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: As the group leaves the inn, Oishi SENSES someone or something watching them from the dark forest. Oishi turns. Scans the woods. But when he finds nothing, turns back and continues on his way. It is only when Oishi is gone that a SHAPE moves from it’ hiding place -- perched high in the shadows of a tree wit metal climbing claws on hands and feet. The most feared a loathed type of mercenary in all of Japan. The NINJA bounds impossibly from treetop to treetop, stal its prey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world’s most-recognizable stratovolcano stands dramatically against the horizon, a THICK COLUMN OF ASH A SMOKE rising from its snowy cone. At the base of the mountain --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: -- leads a half-dozen of his ronin and a complement of BEARERS pulling wagons through the bamboo forest known as “Sea of Trees”. Soon, a clearing reveals a STRUCTURE ON STILTS built up against the side of the mountain. Sitting abandoned for several years, the Lotus Peak looks more like a haunted house than a tea room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrouded in cobwebs, dust and deep shadows... The tea hall is a single greatroom, filled with shoji wal that could subdivide the space into numerous private tea rooms.

dialogues.speaker: HANJO
dialogues.text: I think we’ve been had. Oishi says nothing, moving forward through the darkened space. The others follow. And as they do...  77. We NOTICE the maze of shoji walls begin to SILENTLY SHIFT around them. Unnoticed by Oishi’s men, the ricepaper wall SLIDE into place, SEPARATING the group into smaller and smaller factions. And just as the trap is about to spring OISHI notices a BROKEN COBWEB. And then another. And as h eyes track a SERIES OF BROKEN COBWEBS up the walls and in the shadows, realization hits -- Someone has scaled the walls! Someone is in here with us!

dialogues.speaker: SHINOBI
dialogues.text: Oishi whips his sword out and up before his face just as NINJA strikes from the ceiling shadows like a cobra, spit a SPRAY OF GREEN POISON in his face. ECU AS THE POISON SPRAY hits the flat of Oishi’s blade an DEFLECTED into two separate streams away from Oishi’s nos and_ mouth! Oishi wheels away -- just in time to see a small clay BAL with a LIT FUSE tossed among the samurai. BOOOOM!! The Thunderclap goes off like a cannon, DEAFENING SOUND a BLINDING LIGHT that reveals THE WALLS ARE CRAWLING WITH

dialogues.speaker: NINJA
dialogues.text: [SFX NOTE: As a result of the grenade, the only sound in following scene is the TINNY RINGING of Oishi’s ears.] As the samurai try to shake off the effects of the blast, Ninja STRIKE. Smouldering flames illuminate glimpses of H AND CHAIN grabbing people under their chins and YANKING t up into the darkness. Ninja MATERIALIZING from the shadow and striking with SHURIKKEN, DISK HARPOONS, TIGER CLAWS. ONE BEARER tries stay out of range of a ninja with a spea but realizes too late when it guts him from across the ro that the SPEAR IS EXTENDABLE! It’s like the ambush out of Aliens. The ninja materialize from the dark, attack with inhuman ferocity, then disappe back into shadow. THE BEARERS panic, dying in droves, while -- OISHI’'S MEN master their fear and battle for their lives Suddenly, a chain wraps around Oishi’s sword and RIPS IT into the dark as another ninja attacks with ninja-to, the distinctive ninja straight sword.  78. Reacting without thought, Oishi STEPS INTO THE ATTACK and SLAPS THE BLADE ASIDE with the flat of his hand -- then g the sword’s guard with his fingers and YANKS it out of th ninja’s hands, dispatching him with a move called Flowing Water.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Ronin, to me! MINORU divides one dark warrior into four equal parts, th turns -- as a NINJA POISONER rises from the dark before h The Poisoner spits like a snake, but Minoru is faster, whipping his sword across the man’s neck -- and a GUSH OF PURPLISH TOXIN rushes down the poisoner’s chest from his gaping throat! One by one OISHI AND HIS MEN fight their way to each othe Battle back to back against the dark tide of assassins. But the Ninja have numbers and surprise, forcing our hero into --

dialogues.speaker: THE DEPTHS OF THE TEAHOUSE
dialogues.text: -- where there are no windows. No doors. And no hope for escape. Oishi and his men fight like lions, battling against the crush of assailants, but soon find their backs against th teahouse’s rear wall. Nowhere else to go. Razor-sharp spear points MATERIALIZE from the dark, follo by the ninja warriors who carry them.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Come then, you faceless cowards. (whips blood off his sword My blade still thirsts. The Ninja spearmen CHARGE. Oishi GRABS a spear thrust at chest, stopping it from impaling him, but the kinetic for behind the charge is enough to DRIVE HIM BACK into the wa -- AND THROUGH IT! Wood cracks and splinters as Oishi and his men are propelled through the false rear wall of the teahouse and into --

dialogues.speaker: A VOLCANIC TUNNEL
dialogues.text: -- illuminated by pools of molten lava bubbling up throug the earth.  79. SFX: The demonic percussion of hammers on anvils resounds from the dark ahead. The ninja onslaught drives them toward it. Around a bend the tunnel and into --

dialogues.speaker: HELL'S FORGE
dialogues.text: The secret Ainu swordworks within Mount Fuji. Calderas of molten rock act as FORGES. Steam vents as BELLOWS. Raw iron deposits as ANVILS. Instantly, twenty monstrous OGRES look up from their metalwork. Milky eyes glaring. Rotted teeth snarling. Impossible muscles rippling beneath red, baked skin. There is a terrible frozen moment, then -- CRRRRAAAASSHH! an ENORMOUS HAMMER turns a chunk of volcanic rock to fine dust an inch from Oishi’s face! Oishi leaps back as a SCAR-FACED OGRE charges from the shadows impossibly fast, BELLOWING, and strikes again. Oishi blocks the blow with his sword -- which SHATTERS as it were made of glass.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Gods... And as the inhuman beast strikes again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As WAVES OF OGRES AND NINJAS crash against Oishi’s men, crushing them in nightmarish battle. The ronin fight for their lives in an impossible, terrifying three-way-battle

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: is driven back by the Scar-Faced Ogre’s relentless assaul Hammerblow after hammerblow whooshes past his face with enough force to whip his hair wildly about his face. But just as the Ogre lunges to strike again, Oishi revers his footwork and steps in to perform a move known as Dog Steals Bone and DISARMS the brute, sending his hammer thudding to the floor. Defenseless, the Ogre freezes and Oishi STRIKES! But as Ako'’s swordmaster swings --  80.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: pow (7 ot§ at Ogre) Oishi shoves the monster down and THRUSTS his sword an in above its head -- to SKEWER a NINJA about to cleave the O in half!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Oishi darts off, running into the heart of the battl THE SCAR-FACED OGRE watches him go, realization dawning across his brutish face the man could’ve killed him. That the ronin are not enemies. But the ninja... Scar-Face picks up his hammer and BELLOWS in his savage tongue at his Ainu brethren.

dialogues.speaker: ALL AROUND
dialogues.text: the Ogres immediately CEASE battling Oishi’s ronin...and their fury on the ninja. HANJO can’t believe it when the monster he’s fighting suddenly turns and stands beside him to face two ninja wi chain and sickle. BASHO is getting cut repeatedly by a quick little ninja wielding two daggers when -- WHAM! -- a TITANIC MALLET hammers the little bastard’s head down into his chest cav The Ogre responsible steps from the dark and hands Basho extra mallet. ISOGAI dispatches three ninja and turns in time to see a nearby Ogre get his arm HACKED OFF AT THE ELBOW by a NAGI NINJA. But the Ogre isn’t done fighting. Instead, it shov its bleeding stump deep into a red-hot brazier of coals, cauterizing the wound, then ROARS and dispatches the Nagi wielder.

dialogues.speaker: ISOGAI
dialogues.text: Now that he didn’t expect! But just then, a fresh wave of ninja enter the caves, led a familiar face -- the fearsome Ninja Clanlord -- who dispatches three ogres with terrifying ease. Seeing them coming --

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: tosses his broken sword aside and pulls an unfinished one from the heat of an Ainu forge. The blade is amazingly beautiful, GLOWING RED HOT like something out of legend.  81. When a ninja slashes at him, Oishi reflexively blocks wit the burning blade -- and SHATTERS the ninja’s weapon. As the ninja tries to draw another weapon, Oishi QUENCHES molten blade in his belly. ssssSsssss! The ninja falls, h clothes BURSTING INTO FLAME wherever the blade touches. Oishi looks at the makers mark on the sword.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Koto blade... Oishi grabs two more from the kiln and hurls them toward

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Minoru!

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: dispatches two ninja with his shattered swords, only nubs blade left, and as a half-dozen more close in -- SSSSsss! SSSSsssss! -- two red-hot blades thunk into the backs of of his assailants, impaling them and igniting their cloth Minoru wastes no time, snatching the glowing swords from backs of the fallen and whirling on his attackers like a blazing cyclone.

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: is fighting one ninja, when he suddenly finds himself surrounded by a dozen more. The situation is about to tur deadly when -- A HUGE HAND clamps down on his neck from behind and YANKS BACKWARDS. Another ninja?! No. It’s the Scar-Faced Ogre. He’s dragged Chikara back t the edge of a LAKE OF LAVA. There’s nowhere for them to g But as the ninja surge forward to kill them, Scar-Face ra his mallet high and SWINGS -- But not at the Ninja. AT THE LAVA! FWOOOSH! The hammer sends a SHEET OF LAVA at the attackin ninja who scream and burn. Instantly, Chikara and Scar-Fa charge forward, slashing and bashing the ninja down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all of Oishi’s men begin grabbing up koto blades out kilns, out of forges. And the battlegrounds becomes aligh flaming swords against shadowy ninja.  82. And the tides begin to turn. OISHI fights with the precision and grace of his rank, shattering ninja weapons setting fire to ninja with every stroke of his legendary blade. Quickly, the ninja are overcome, slain to a man, except f the --

dialogues.speaker: NINJA CLANLORD
dialogues.text: -- who sidesteps a battle with SMOKE BOMBS and races off through the caves. But Oishi and Minoru are already in pursuit, chasing the Ninja Lord through a series of steam-filled tunnels and i

dialogues.speaker: A STALACTITE-FILLED CHAMBER
dialogues.text: -- where a hundred bubbling pools of lava dot the cave fl Oishi and Minoru catch the Ninja Lord and the fight is on the ronin’s glowing swords working in tandem against the Ninja Lord’s terrible chain and claw. The tempo of the battle gets faster and faster, until the moves are simply a blur. And that’s when the Clanlord takes it up a notch. Suddenly, Oishi and Minoru’s concentrated attacks are outpaced by the Ninja Lord’s IMPOSSIBLE SPEED and, for th first time ever, Oishi finds himself OUTSKILLED and on th defensive. The Clan Lord unleashes a flurry of chainwork that finds holes in Oishi’s blocks, in Minoru’s ripostes, slashing t bashing them, forcing them back to the edge of a CALDERA LAVA where Oishi and Minoru fight, teetering for balance the edge of the molten pool... Seeing his opportunity, the Clan Lord SMILES. But just as moves to force them in -- The Scar-Faced Ogre appears from the dark and SMASHES THE

dialogues.speaker: BASTARD NINJA SCREAMING INTO THE LAVA
dialogues.text: Oishi and Minoru look at one another, then at the Ainu... exhale for the first time in minutes, knowing how very cl they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ainu “Ogres” clean-up, dragging the bodies of the sla ninja and tossing them into the lava pools, while--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the ronin finish securing their carts now filled with legendary weapons. With Mt. Fuji pointing heavenward in the plum-colored sky behind them, Oishi bows deeply before the Scar-Faced Ogre clearly the Ainu leader. Minoru and Chikara do the same.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Thank you, noble one. The Scar-Faced Ogre returns the bow, then looks Oishi in eye. Speaks with a voice like the grumbling of deep caver Something he hasn’t done in years.

dialogues.speaker: SCAR-FACED OGRE
dialogues.text: May you..be strong and diligent...in your deeds. And with a final bow, the ronin depart, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campsite has been set up. All 47 ronin have regathered. It is clear they have been travelling hard, for all sleep the ground, utterly exhausted. Except for two. While the others sleep, Minoru and Chikara, practice swordwork by the light of the campfire. Minoru instructs in several maneuvers, counterbalancing his left-handednes with a knife in his right hand. And as the two practice maneuvers again and again, Chikara getting better with ea try --

dialogues.speaker: HIGH IN THE JAPANESE MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: An ESTABLISHING SHOT of a landscape of snowcapped peaks a black pine... And dominating all from three thousand feet up the steep snowy mountainside, FIND Kira’s impregnable YAMASHIRO (ca fortress) looming over the world like a grim stone threat  84. Even from our aerial shot, we can see that wedding preparations are underway below. Cheerful silks being arranged. Red lanterns being hung. Excessive pomp and circumstance that is the hallmark of the Master of Protoc But even while all these festivities are being prepared, another part of the castle, the emotional climate is very different. EXT. KIRA’S FORTRESS - BALCONY Mika and Lord Kira sit in heavy robes, staring out at a f rimed koi pond in a winter garden below. Candles float on the surface, the fish move sluggishly below. It’s majestic and beautiful, but somehow very sad. They sit in silence, the only sound the quiet movements o SCRAWNY BOY fanning a brazier to keep them warm while he himself shivers in his thin kimono. Then --

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: (reciting) Spring departs. Birds cry. Fishes' eyes are filled with tears. (to Mika) Are you familiar with the works of Basho? But Mika is more concerned about the shivering boy.

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: The child is cold.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Is this so? (turns to the boy) Are you cold, boy? Do you wish for me to send you away? It’s not a threat. Not quite. The boy shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAWNY BOY
dialogues.text: (teeth chattering) No, my Lord. I am warm.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: You see, Lady Asano? You are mistaken. Kira pours thick green tea into earthenware raku tea bowl for the both of them, then rises to stare out at the view  85.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you are about a great many things... With his back momentarily turned away, Mika seizes the opportunity and slips a SMALL SACHET OF POWDER from the sleeve of her robe. Pours the contents into Kira’s drink. She conceals the sachet just in time as Kira turns around picks up his tea cup. He lifts it to his lips and is abou to drink -- -- when he NOTICES Mika watching him with interest. It’s first time she’s done so. Kira instantly becomes suspicio Realizing her mistake, Mika looks calmly away...but it’s late. Kira notices several GRANULES on the table by his c Kira’s eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But perhaps I spoke too soon. The child does look cold. Kira takes his tea cup -- and offers it to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here, boy. Warm yourself. Drink this. The boy is hesitant, then takes the cup with trembling ha savoring the warmth. Mika watches the boy. Kira watches her. And just as the boy tilts the cup to his lips --

dialogues.speaker: MIKA
dialogues.text: No! -- Mika breaks and SLAPS the cup out of his hands, shatte it against the ground. Kira looms over her as she crumples to the ground, weepin

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: How like your father you are... Rash. And a fool. Kira leans down and takes her face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And so close to meeting his same fate. You play at games where you do not fully comprehend the stakes. But I promise you this: when we are wed -- (venomous ) I will teach them to you.  86. Lord Kira strides away, leaving Mika empty and devastated the balcony, staring helplessly out at the foothills beyo her reach below. And as she does, PUSH IN and VFX SKIM miles down the mountainside to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where Oishi, Minoru and a dozen others belly-crawl thr the long grass to reach a vantage point at the top of a r Far above them, Kira’s castle fortress clutches the mountaintop like some sinister stone spider. The ronin stare at it, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: OKUDA
dialogues.text: We should attack tonight. It will be a long climb, but our thirst for justice will fuel us -- Oishi shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Attacking Kira’s stronghold would be a futile gesture. The walls are impregnable and he garrisons a thousand soldiers inside. (beat ) No. Any attempt on his fortress would be doomed to failure.

dialogues.speaker: OKUDA
dialogues.text: Then what have we travelled all this way for? To wait for Kira to march down the hill and present himself to us. (imitating Kira) Why, hello, Oishi. Here’s my neck. Strike swiftly please. A ironic smirk crinkles Oishi’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: That is exactly what we are going to do. Okuda and the others are confused. So Oishi directs their gaze, not up at Kira’s fortress...but down at his fiefdom the valley below. At the foot of the mountain sits Kira’s jinaimachi -- or temple town -- comprised of various community buildings a farms that all bear Lord Kira’s FAMILY CREST: a red octop against a golden field.  87.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lady Asano’s period of mourning comes to an end in two days. In honor of their union, Kira has ordered the entire realm to pay a tribute at the Founder’s Temple. Oishi points at the two-story wooden structure in the cen of the rural village. Sohei, or warrior monks, move about the temple in their distinctive robes the color of dried blood.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Kira himself will be there to collect the prize. (beat) Greed ever diminishes wisdom... Oishi turns back to his men, determined.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the very impulse that drove him to betray our lord, is the same weapon we will use against him. And off Oishi’s words, Minoru turns and looks up at the castle. Stares as if searching for Mika. Almost as if the two are connected, and he is returning h earlier gaze...

dialogues.speaker: AN ORNATE PALANQUIN
dialogues.text: So massive and gaudy, it can only belong to one man. Thirty men bear the garish litter toward the center of to escorted by a ring of two hundred heavily-armed soldiers. When they reach the Temple, Lord Kira steps out in a bomb of silk and blackened teeth. As he steps inside, PULL BACK TO REVEAL we are: EXT. KIRA’S TEMPLE TOWN - THE NEXT MORNING Abuzz with activity, centering on the Founder’s Temple. Thousands of merchants, townsfolk and farmers come from a across the land bearing their wedding tributes in the for rice, livestock, textiles or coin. Soldiers and monks herd everyone into an orderly line tha extends hundreds of yards out of the temple.  88. At the edge of town, NOTICE a LONE FARMER entering the village, carrying his offering of two bolts of silk. As t farmer gets closer and we get a peek beneath his broad ha we realize it’s OISHI in disguise. As Oishi nears the temple, he blends in with the crowd, subtly glances around, taking everything in. Formulating a battle plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noting the positions of the soldiers around the temple... The MATCHLOCK MUSKETS they carry... The four CANNONS stationed beside the temple and, as a soldier exits, a small magazine room where BARRELS OF GUNPOWDER (marked with the Dutch East India crest) are stored...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SHOT
dialogues.text: as Oishi is goaded by the soldiers into the long line of farmers to make his offering and meekly complies. Once there, he looks around and SPOTS familiar faces interspersed throughout the crowd. HANJO disguised as a beet-farmer. ISOGAI disguised as an artist. BASHO as a workman. As a cart filled with wedding gifts rumbles past on its w up the mountain, MINORU, disguised as a peasant, maneuver close enough to SLIP IN A SMALL WRAPPED PACKAGE of his ow The line moves forward and soon Oishi finds himself at th temple steps. Above the doorway hangs an immense painting the temple’s founder, Lord Kira. Below that is a smaller, almost stingy one of the Supreme Buddha. Oishi stops for a moment, struck by the mind-boggling van of it all.

dialogues.speaker: YOU THERE
dialogues.text: Suddenly -- WAAAAP! -- Oishi is struck across the shoulde by a sword scabbard. An IMPOSING SOLDIER looms before him Oishi tries to keep his face downcast as the Soldier stud him, but --  89.

dialogues.speaker: IMPOSING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Look at me. (when Oishi doesn’t)

dialogues.speaker: LOOK AT ME
dialogues.text: Oishi does. And just as we’re sure he’s about to be caugh

dialogues.speaker: IMPOSING SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep the line moving. Oishi is as surprised as we are. Nods readily and shuffle away, ignoring the Soldier’s muttered curse of --

dialogues.speaker: IMPOSING SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Brainless peasants. -- as he moves off into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prayer candles and incense dominate the interior of the t storied hondo -- or main hall -- filled with townsfolk. LORD KIRA sits in a chair befitting his status, behind a screen of gossamer silk to prevent the gaze of peasants f sullying him. It is from there he surveys his offerings. Oishi watches as a PIG FARMER approaches the screen and h over five piglets in a cart. An ACOLYTE records the information in the official roll. Kira never says a word. Kira’s functionary, the temple’s CHIEF MONK, does all the interacting with the lesser peoples.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK
dialogues.text: Next. As the Soldier escorts the farmer away, the Chief Monk tu his gaze on Oishi.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Step forward. Oishi steps before the screen shrouding Kira’s visage.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Name and offering?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Two bolts of silk, Holy One. The Chief Monk tries to take the bolts, but Oishi holds f to them. The Monk sighs and turns to the Acolyte.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK
dialogues.text: Note that they are exceedingly poor specimens. Moth eaten. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The cheapest sort. (turns back to Oishi) Is this insult all you bring your liege lord?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: No, there is more...but I fear your master will enjoy it even less. The Chief Monk begins to grow suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK
dialogues.text: Who are you? State your name!

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: With pleasure. Oishi turns to the screen, eyes steely.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My name is Oishi Kuranosuke -- (the silhouette reacts) -- and the tribute I bring is the vengeance of Lord Asano Naganori. Realizing the danger the warrior monk goes for a weapon, in one swift move Oishi draws a sword concealed within th bolt of silk -- so sharp that it SLICES through the thous layers of fabric as it is drawn out -- and SMASHES the mo in the head with the steel butt of the blade. The Chief Monk DROPS like rag doll. Faster than anyone can react, Oishi slices through veiled screen -- SCHRRIIIP! -- and is about to hack Kira down wh Oishi STOPS DEAD. The man cowering before him is not Kira...but an effemina AIDE acting as his double. And as the implications of thi sink in--

dialogues.speaker: BEING COCKED ECHOES AROUND THE ROOM.
dialogues.text: Oishi looks up to see Kira RIFLE AND BOWMEN ringing the balcony above, all with their weapons trained on him. And below, every one of the warrior monks holds an exotic wea in hand -- WHIP CHAINS, TIGER HOOKS, IRON FANS. The room goes deathly still, everyone holding their breat In the silence that follows, only one sound can be heard. LAUGHTER. Oishi turns to see the Chief Monk, laughing through blood-stained teeth.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK
dialogues.text: We knew you would come.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: How. .? HEAVY FOOTSTEPS resound from an alcove...and like a demon returned fresh from hell, the NINJA CLANLORD steps from t shadows. Pulls down his mask to reveal half his face has become a MELTED, SCARIFIED HORROR from the lava beneath M Fuji. It’s the last person on earth Oishi wants to see.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF MONK
dialogues.text: Kira is safe in his fortress, ronin. Unlike you. (to his musketeers above) Kill him. The crowd swiftly moves away from Oishi as the musketeers draw a bead, and just as they are about to fire -- One of the musketeers heads just SLIDES OFF HIS SHOULDERS TOPPLES to the floor below. Another’s arm simply SEPARATES at the shoulder, dropping musket. An archer SCREAMS as two feet of shining steel protrude through his chest, lancing his heart. Still another is CLEAVED IN ‘TWAIN, from crown to root, a falls apart in two symmetrical pieces -- revealing Minoru standing behind him. As other ronin go to work on the rest and blood and body parts rain down, the crowd ERUPTS IN CHAOS. Utter mayhem ensues as two hundred villagers run in every direction. Instantly --

dialogues.speaker: THE NINJA CLANLORD
dialogues.text: turns to look back -- and discovers Oishi gone. Blended b into the crowd. Around him, soldiers and warrior monks begin to drop as t ronin attack like ghosts, materializing to slit a throat, then vanishing back into the crowd. In the pandemonium, it’s impossible to tell harmless vill from foe. To the Chief Monk, there is only one solution.  92.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: a dozen of Kira’s men begin to swing the massive temple d shut.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Muskets THUNDER. Arrows FLY. And Oishi sees their only chance of escape closing. The doors are so colossal that once they’re shut, there will be no opening them. Amid the chaos, Oishi spots the sumo-sized Basho in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BASHO
dialogues.text: The giant looks up and responds instantly, surging forwar and bowling a path through the crowd to reach the tremend doors a heartbeat before closing. He hits them like a force of nature, driving the dozen me trying to close them back a foot, their boots skidding lo across the stone floor. But that’s where the forward momentum stops and the war o strength begins. OUTSIDE, more men pile on the doors, try to force them shut, while INSIDE Basho strains mightily against their combined efforts. KIRA’S SOLDIERS AND WARRIOR MONKS lash out at anyone within reach -- men, women, children - but find their weapons BLOCKED by ronin swords that appea from nowhere, protecting the innocents then striking thei own lethal return blow. An arrow about to take a child’s life is SEVERED IN MID-A by Minoru’s saving sword -- and before the cleaved arrow fall to the ground, Minoru snatches it out of the sky and stabs it into the face of an attacking warrior monk. OISHI defends against three warrior monks, SHATTERING all three of their weapons with a single angry strike. But as much damage as they’re doing, the ronin are desperately outnumbered and are starting to take heavy casualties.  93. ISOGAI and others take a hail of musket balls through the shoulders, legs, arms. HANJO barely slips aside from an iron fan slice chop mean brain him and loses his left ear for the effort. MINORU ducks away from a decapitating swipe of a RAZOR-SH WHIP CHAIN and we PUSH INTO A SLOW-MO ECU as the tip of t enemy’s steel whip NICKS HIS NECK, drawing only a single of blood. And though he fells one opponent after another, OISHI’s b is RAKED OPEN by dual tiger hooks. They have to get out.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Basho is a human pincushion of arrows, an easy target for archers who do everything in their power to drop him. But for all the arrows sticking out of his back, Basho struggles titanically against--

dialogues.speaker: THE NOW TWENTY SOLDIERS ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE
dialogues.text: who, in unison, try to force the doors closed enough for six soldiers waiting to drop the heavy WOODEN LOCK BAR -- thick as the trunk of a great tree -- in place. It’s a wa of millimeters as the men try to force the lock bar in place...but Basho holds the doors just a hair too wide fo to fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another arrow buries itself in Basho’s back and he loses valuable ground. OISHI sees his men taking heavy damage and calls out agai their only hope.

dialogues.speaker: BASHO
dialogues.text: And just as --

dialogues.speaker: THE SOLDIERS OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: slide the lock bar in place --  94.

dialogues.speaker: BASHO
dialogues.text: hears his master’s voice and digs deep to the titan withi and SURGES FORWARD WITH EVERY LAST OUNCE OF SUPERHUMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, the panicking crowd races through the opening, 47 ronin blending in with them.

dialogues.speaker: THE NINJA CLANLORD
dialogues.text: races out of the temple with his soldiers and sohei -- an confronted by the sight of thousands of taxpayers racing from the temple in every conceivable direction. Trying to find the ronin among the stampeding crowd would like trying to find a needle in a haystack...in the heart a raging typhoon. Though suffering staggering injuries, Oishi and his men h gotten away...

dialogues.speaker: A RED SILKEN CLOTH
dialogues.text: Then a dozen ORACLE BONES are cast across it. The turtle shell fragments tumble and come to rest, and t tiny hands ENTER FRAME and begin to search by feel for th ones that have landed with their inscribed Kanji characte facing up. PULL BACK TO REVEAL we are -—— INT. KIRA’S MOUNTAIN CASTLE - THE LORD’S QUARTERS - LATER Lord Kira waits impatiently for his fortune to be read by court PROPHETS -- a pair of ten-year-old children. The divinators are fraternal twins, a boy and a girl. It’s the boy whose hands feel the shells.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Well..? When the boy looks up, we see his milky eyes and know tha is BLIND. He looks to his sister and she stares into his eyes. No words pass between them. Then --  95.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL PROPHET
dialogues.text: He says you will travel great distances. That a hundred thousand shall prostrate themselves before you as you pass. That even the Shogun will bow before you in awe.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: And how shall this honor occur? The boy casts again and turns to his sister.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL PROPHET
dialogues.text: He says two feathers shall lift you up. And on that day, you will live in the minds of your countrymen forever.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Hmm. I am glad of pleasant news for a change. They are interrupted by a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enter. A MESSENGER enters. Bows deeply. Kira doesn’t even turn t acknowledge him.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: The ronin appeared, exactly as you said they would, my lord.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Yes? And how large was their force?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Several dozen men, I am told.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: That is all? (scoffs) Pathetic... The Messenger waits as Kira falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wish to see the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: There..are none, my lord. Now Kira turns.  96.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: None?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: They ran. Fought free of the trap and scattered to the wi--

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Oishi ran?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Yes, lord.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: Ronin... (shakes his head) It should not, but cowardice such as that surprises even me. Their master was a fool, but even he had enough propriety to take his life when shamed. Kira rises and makes his way to the balcony overlooking t bonsai garden below. Gazes out.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A Lord is the spine of his people. Do you see now what happens when that spine is broken? When samurai have no master? Disgraceful! (then) Marshall the troops.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Which divisions, my lord?

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: All of them. (beat) Scour the countryside. Let none of Oishi’s men get away. I want these ronin hunted down like the gutless dogs they are.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: And the wedding, Lord?

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: What of it?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: In light of the danger, it’s been suggested we postpone it.  97.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: The only danger is to Lady Asano. In their excitement, many accidents have fallen on brides on their wedding night. (malicious) The moment I wed her, I will become a widower...and the true legal ruler of Asano lands in more than name only. (grim beat) No. The wedding goes on. As the Messenger bows and exits, we PRELAP A MAN CRYING O IN AGONY, and --

dialogues.speaker: A DEEP AND TERRIBLE SWORD WOUND
dialogues.text: HANDS trying to hold the skin together, trying to stop th gushing blood. The victim is one of Oishi’s ronin. The ma trying to staunch the flow (SHIOTA) is another.

dialogues.speaker: SHIOTA
dialogues.text: It won’t stop!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: Hold him down. It’s Minoru. As they hold him, Minoru takes his sword fro the coals of a brazier. The blade GLOWS ORANGE with heat SIZZLES as he presses it to the wound. The injured ronin shrieks...but when the sword is taken a the laceration has been CAUTERIZED. Now WIDEN TO REVEAL the rest of the scene. It’s a horror show of post-battle triage. BASHO having the arrows cut f his back. OKUDA having his cheek stitched together from a cut you can see his teeth through. ISOGAI grunting as thi fingers pull a musketball from his shoulder. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the ronin are licking their wounds from their narro escape.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK ROOM
dialogues.text: Oishi watches the scene in despair. Minoru enters and sta beside him.  98.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: The soldiers have passed. We'll be safe for a few hours, but they’1l be coming back. It’s a quiet, tragic moment as they stare at the men. The

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: I have miscalculated. My pride has brought us to this. (beat) Perhaps we should have acted the night of Asano’s death. We were vastly outnumbered, but at least we would have died valiantly. With honor. Now we are only ronin... (beat) ...and we have failed our lord. Minoru has never seen this side of Oishi, and it scares h little.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: We all go our separate ways. Scatter to the wind.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: We run?

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: We live. For as long as we can. Maybe there will be another day. The one advantage we had was the element of total surprise, and it is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: Is it? Oishi looks at him...and amazingly, the man is grinning.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: A great warrior once said, “If the enemy thinks of the mountains, attack like the sea; and if he think of the sea, attack like the mountains.” Minoru turns then...and Oishi follows his gaze to the sno peaks looming above Kira’s fortress.

dialogues.speaker: MINORU
dialogues.text: They expect us to run. Shouldn’t we attack?  99. Oishi slowly smiles at his own words coming back to him. spark has been rekindled in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: Gather the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the MUSIC RISES, the 47 Ronin don the same formal atti they wore when they first greeted the Shogun -- the TRADITIONAL UNIFORM OF THE ASANO CLAN. It is the first time they have worn the Asano CREST since their disgrace. Etched in moonlight, they look like a bat force stepped from myth. Oishi looks them all over with pride.

dialogues.speaker: OISHI
dialogues.text: While the result may be uncertain, by dawn they will know the courage of the Asano Clan! The men unleash a cheer that can be heard by the gods. They're ready.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. KIRA’S FORTRESS - FORMAL CHAMBER - NIGHT The room is filled with a sea of colorfully-wrapped WEDDI PRESENTS. Mika sits among them, despondent. Hopeless. Reality setti in. There is no getting out of this. This is her future. Overcome by frustration, Mika hurls a table of gifts asid As the brightly-colored boxes cascade to the ground, a kaiken -- or SMALL BRIDAL SWORD symbolically given for luck -- spills out of one of the packages. Mika picks up the ceremonial blade, her hands begin to tremble. Maybe there is a way out of this... Mika closes her eyes and exhales, trying to calm herself -- then rais the knife to her own jugular. With the clock running down on the Shogun’s decree, Mika gives in to hopelessness and steels herself for this last statement of defiance against Kira. To die among their wedding gifts.  100. TEARS begin to run down her cheeks. And just as she cries out and makes the move to slash her own throat -- Mika’s eyes fall on something she recognizes among the se presents. A gift wrapped in a swatch of silk BEARING HER FAMILY CREST. Mika gasps and drops the knife as she races to pick up th package. Unwraps it the reveal a block of ivory delicatel carved into the shape of a single beautiful SAKURA BLOSSO Mika begins to cry, but now in joy. Minoru is here. He is coming for her. As hope grows in her eyes, filling her with renewed stren and Mika laughs for the first time in a year --

dialogues.speaker: ROCK THE CASTLE
dialogues.text: Startled, Mika races to the balcony, where a SLITHERING N begins to fill the air, GROWING LOUDER with every passing second. Like a titanic snake sliding down the mountain. INT. KIRA’S CHAMBERS - SAME TIME Kira is asleep in his opulent bed...when a sound so deep powerful begins to VIBRATE the wall stones in their morta Softly at first, but then violently enough to wake him in panic. Kira races a window...where he sees a LINE OF TORCHES alo path to the top of the mountain begin to WINK OUT as something swallows them, one by one, descending toward th castle.

dialogues.speaker: LORD KIRA
dialogues.text: What in hell --? EXT. KIRA’S MOUNTAIN CASTLE - PARAPET WALK - CONTINUOUS Kira’s GUARDS stand frozen atop the outer defensive wall, staring out at the terrible darkness racing down the mountain, heading straight for them. The noise is DEAFENI And as they watch in horror, the cause of the disturbance blasts into the pool of light around the castle -- A MILLION CUBIC FEET OF ICE roars down the mountain, righ Kira’s castle! The avalanche speeds downward in a solid mass, like a vengeful tectonic plate sliding downhill, OBLITERATING everything in its path. A YOUNG GUARD is paralyzed by the sight.  101.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GUARD
dialogues.text: Gods... A shout Guard #1 jolts him back to motion.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALARM, YOU FOOL
dialogues.text: The Young Guard runs through the chaos of the walk to rea MASSIVE BELL in the tower. But just as he grabs the rope swing the log clapper --

dialogues.speaker: FIND COVER
dialogues.text: WHAAAAAAAMMMM! The entire castle SHUDDERS as the avalanch COLLIDES into the wall and -- WHOOOOOOOOOOSH!! The snow sweeps across the parapet walk like the Wrath of God, sending everyone screaming into th abyss.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALARM TOWER ALONG THE REAR WALL
dialogues.text: The Young Guard swings the clapper -- GONNGGGG! -- but th sound is swallowed as the avalanche reaches the tower and CRACKKK! -- tears the entire structure away from the wall like the hand of frost giant child dissatisfied with his castle. The Young Guard screams as the tower shears from its foundation and we TRACK WITH HIM as it tumbles all the wa down the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kira’s elite samurai race from their barracks by the hundreds, each wearing the Lovecraftian armor of House Yoshinaka. Their bodies covered in lacquered black scales and their kabuto helms wrought into the shape of the DEMO OCTOPUS that is his sigil, eight bladed STEEL TENTACLES dangling down their backs. They reach the breech in the wall, but can see nothing through the thick clouds of swirling ice crystals. Then SHAPES appear in the dense fog. OCTOPUS SAMURAI #1 is the first to recognize the danger.

dialogues.speaker: RONIN
dialogues.text: Oishi steps through the mist.  102. The Octopus rushes him, but Oishi SIDESTEPS and grabs the steel tentacles dangling from the Octopus’ helm. YANKS do exposing a gap beneath his chin, and thrusts his sword wi all his pent up rage -- SKEWERING straight through the warrior’s brain AND the top of his ornate helm. With a savage twist, Oishi splits the man’s face and helm WRENCHES his sword free. Oishi stands there, chest heaving, splattered in blood... gives the WARCRY he’s been waiting to give since the nigh his master’s death.

dialogues.speaker: FOR LORD ASANO
dialogues.text: And the two armies race at one another to begin the great swordfight in history: Oishi’s ronin against a thousand elite samurai. And as the entire castle’s defenses surge at the invaders

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that the defenders are rushing toward the other side the castle, a half-dozen scaling hooks sail over this abandoned section of perimeter wall and -- CLINK-CLINK! - latch on! Moments later, OKUDA, HAZAMA, two other burly ronin and CHIKARA clamber up to the walk.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BELOW
dialogues.text: a DARK SHAPE stomps into the courtyard. The NINJA CLANLOR surveys the battle -- and spots OKUDA and his force headi for the CANNON atop the rampart wall. The Clanlord grits his melted jaw so hard, we can hear th muscles creak.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE REAR OF THE CASTLE
dialogues.text: In the midst of battle, Oishi looks up and sees Chikara a the others racing across the wall...and below them, a SQU OF NINJA spider-climbing the walls. Oishi calls out, trying to warn his son --

dialogues.speaker: CHIKARA
dialogues.text: -- but he can’t hear him over the din of battle.  103. Then -- swish! --a sword swipe brings his focus back to t battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he did against the Brigands at the beginning of the fi As Kira’s octopodian army closes in, Oishi MENTALLY DISSE THE SCENE. From a WIDE ANGLE, we RACK IN on the courtyard particular geographic features: a three-foot thick INNER GATE that prevents them from reaching the castle proper, MAZE OF OUTBUILDINGS on this side of that gate, the SLIGH RISE of a particular path weaving between them. Then on t WEAPONS HIS OPPONENTS CARRY, noting in VFX their effectiv lethal range and the most immediate threat -- a LINE OF SPEARMEN charging them. Faster than thought, Oishi has his plan and puts it into action.

dialogues.speaker: FORMATION
dialogues.text: Instantly, the ronin form up in a particular configuratio and as the enemy spearmen close in as a wave --

dialogues.speaker: KESA
dialogues.text: Oishi’s samurai react in unison, MIRRORING the training w saw them practicing on bamboo targets at the start of the film. The ANGLES and CAMERA SHOTS are identical, except t time it’s not bamboo they chop, but their opponents’ SPEA SCHUNK-SHUNKK-SCHUNKK! Forty of Kira’s spears are reaped like wheat. Then -- SCHUNK-SHUNKK-SCHUNKK! -- so are the that hold them.

dialogues.speaker: NORTH FRONT
dialogues.text: Koto blades flash diagonally up, CLEAVING through fresh r of Kira’s spearmen, shattering their enemies’ arms and ar with a quality of weapons and skill Kira’s fighters canno match. Then Oishi charges forward, leading his men into the maze structures where the narrow walls reduce the advantage of numbers Kira’s army has. At a particular stretch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Kira’s army closes on both sides and the ronin def on two fronts: Oishi and the remaining ronin on the right side, and Minoru almost single-handedly holding the left

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE WALL
